loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: After graduating with a diploma, Gifty decided to set up her own provision business in Mpohor (near Takoradi). With over three years worth of experience, she is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more provisions for resale. She aims to use the profits from her business to help support her husband (who is a miner) with the upkeep of their house, whilst ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions for resale.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns more income from selling kitchenware and raising livestock.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional ready-to-wear clothing to sell. Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a small-scale baker who bakes bread for sale in Mpohor (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education, as she is a junior high school graduate. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver.  

Dorcas has been working as a baker for close to three years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of flour and sugar to make her bread, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demand.

She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a bread stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of flour and sugar to make her bread.

loans.name: Festus

texts.en:
Festus is 41 years old, married and a father of four children. For the last 10 years, he has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables from his food kiosk in Malindi. He earns a monthly income of about 10,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) from the business. 

Festus was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for his second loan of 30,000 KES to buy additional stock for his kiosk such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges and onions for sale to his customers. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children as well as continue expanding the business. His goal for the future is to continue growing the business so that he may uplift his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for his kiosk such as tomatoes, pineapples, oranges and onions.

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz is 42 years old and is married with 5 children. The family survives solely on coffee farming and cattle raising. Boaz has become innovative, and from his small savings he has started a petrol selling business to provide for the off season. He has diversified into cattle fattening to increase his supply of organic manure to put onto his coffee plantation. 

Now, he has applied for a loan to buy fertilizers for putting on his plantation during this rainy season in anticipation of higher yields next season. He is excited about the partnership with Kiva through UGAFODE Microfinance.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: El sr. Héctor, es casado su esposa es ama de casa, tienen dos hijos y toda su familia dependen de él ya que solamente él trabaja y asegura la manutención del hogar como los gastos del colegio de los niños con su trabajo como operario de limpieza desde hace muchos años. Solicita el crédito para la construcción de un anexo el cual destinara para sala ya que actualmente  ocupa una sola área para sala y cocina lo que es una situación muy incómoda para él y su familia, así como también construirá una pared ya que está pegado del muro de otra casa vecina y necesita independizarse.
texts.en:
Mr. Héctor is married and has two children. His wife is a housewife and the family depends on his support, since he is the only one that has a paid job. He pays for the home expenses and the children’s education, and has been working as a cleaner for many years. 

Héctor is requesting a loan to build an additional room, which will become his living room. The kitchen and the living room are today located in the same room, which is uncomfortable for him and his family. He will also build a wall to separate his house from the neighbors’, since they share a wall. This will improve his privacy.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron and gravel.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.en:
Lazaro is a married man and has been blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past four years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of stiff competition in his business. Lazaro dreams of expanding his business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 he wants to purchase retail shop items like wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil. Lazaro joined Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase retail shop items like wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 26 years old, single, and has one child. She has been running a boutique for two years with an income of about 18,000 KES a month. 

Julie is requesting her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock of clothes to sell.  She hopes to be able to meet her basic financial needs and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine  is married. She received some schooling, till the end of  Junior high school. Currently,  Josephine  sells movies, discs, tapes, DVDs, pen drives, etc. in Mpohor  (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this business for about  three years now. Her husband is a tailor.  

Josephine's  income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.   She will use the loan to expand her existing inventory of movies, discs, tapes etc.. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise,   Josephine plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to expand her existing inventory of movies, discs, tapes, DVD, pen drives, etc.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Pour prêter main forte à son conjoint(menuisier en aluminium) dans les charges du foyer, Adjowa a débuté en 2012 par vendre des produits congelés. Manquant de fonds pour  acheter ses marchandises, elle sollicite l’aide de WAGES par un premier prêt. Cet argent lui permettra d'acheter des produits congelés. Comme perspectives d‘avenir, elle espère acheter un autre réfrigérateur et assurer les besoins de la famille. Notons qu’elle est maman de deux adorables enfants scolarisés âgés de 07 et 05ans.
texts.en:
To help out her husband (an aluminum furniture maker) to cover household expenses, Adjowa started off by selling frozen products in 2012. Lacking the funds to purchase her merchandise, she is requesting financial aid from WAGES with an initial loan. This money will enable her to purchase frozen products. 

For the future, she hopes to purchase another refrigerator and to ensure that her family's needs are met. Let us note that she is a mom with two adorable children in school who are 7 and 5 years old.

loans.use: to purchase frozen products to sell

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en:
One of two breadwinners in a family with two children who are still in school, Savorn is a rural farmer from Battambang province. To cover their daily cost of living, she has managed to have a small vegetable garden, growing cabbages and peas as the main source of income while her husband works for others for a fee for extra income, besides helping her on the farmland. The current business has returned her a decent income to support her living, 26,400 KHR per day. 

Savorn is a seventh-cycle client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loans completely which has enabled her to stablize her living conditions in a proper standard of living. Now, in a group of four, she is the leader. The total requested loan amount of her group is 3,600,000 KHR. Savorn, whose loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR, will spend her loan to buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can make more income so she can buy an additional plot of farmland to make her business larger.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Analiza works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Analiza is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell to her customers.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena  is a widow and lives together with her seven dependents.  Abena sells foodstuffs like plantains and coco-yams  in Jukwa near Abura which she has done for 30 years. As a single parent she uses her income to feed and clothe her children.  She will use her loan to purchase more plantains to sell. With the new profit, Abena hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plantains to sell

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en: Anabelle, 44 years of age, is separated from her husband and now she's taking care of her six children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost five years. In her business her net income is 100 PHP daily, and she would like to access an income amounting to 11,000 PHP to purchase coffee, sugar, cooking oil, and beverages. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will improve.

loans.use: To purchase coffee, sugar, cooking oil, and beverages

loans.name: Kouassi

texts.fr: Père d’un enfant de 05ans, mr Kouassi mariée est revendeur et en même temps peintre bâtiment. Il revend des sacs de charbons de bois qu’il achète à Lomé et dans les villes de l’intérieur du pays. Démarré en 2008 cette activité, il s'y plait bien car cela lui procure des revenus lui permettant de se prendre en charge. Il sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour renforcer son activité de vente de charbons de bois. Il espère agrandir son secteur d’activité et assurer au mieux au besoin de la famille.
texts.en: The father of a 5-year-old child, Mr. Kouassi is a retailer and a building painter at the same time. He sells sacks of charcoal which he purchases in Lomé and from inland cities. Starting this business in 2008, he is very pleased, since it brings in the revenues enabling him to support himself. He is requesting an initial loan from WAGES to bolster his business selling charcoal. He hopes to expand his business sector and to ensure his family's needs are met.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Layidou Group

texts.fr:
Les  cinq femmes du groupe Layidou sont toutes mariées  dans les familles polygamiques avec en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Ouolobougouni dans la commune rurale de Sakoiba dans la 4ème région administrative du Mali. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce du lait de vache de toutes sortes (lait frais, caillé et du yaourt) et des grains (haricot, mil et riz). Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1ier  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Dado (femme assise devant avec le bidon bleu sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de lait de toutes sortes dans le village de Ouolobougouni;  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 250 litres de lait avec les éleveurs du village. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame  Dado espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 16 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en:
The five women of the group Layidou are all married in polygamous families. The women average 35 years of age and four children each all living in the village of Ouolobougouni, in Commune Rurale de Sakoiba (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of community, marriage, and kinship in the village. They have small-scale businesses involving cow's milk of all kinds (fresh milk, curdled, yogurt) and grains (beans, millet, and rice). 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Dado (the woman seated in front with a blue container in the photo) is a major vendor of milk of all sorts in the village of Ouolobougouni; she intends to use her loan to purchase 250 liters of milk from the livestock farmers in the village. The sales are made, cash or credit, to a customer base composed of men and women. 

With this loan, Ms. Dado hopes to make an average monthly profit of 16,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and ensuring her children's care.

loans.use: to purchase fresh cow's milk

loans.name: Urania Lisseth

texts.es:
Urania tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Ella es costurera desde los 14 años de edad, gracia a que sus padres la apoyaron para que aprendiera este oficio y también conoce el oficio de estilismo. Actualmente esta costurando los uniformes de los estudiantes de escuelas publicas en el país. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar una tela que le sirve para los uniformes escolares. Así, ella terminara de elaborar los uniformes y empleara a más personas para que le ayuden. Su idea es establecer su propio taller para crecer y aumentar el número de clientes.
texts.en:
Urania is 32 years old, married, and has three children. She has been a seamstress since she was 14, thanks to the fact that her parents helped her to learn this trade, and she also knows hairdressing. Currently she is selling student uniforms used in the country's public schools.

The loan she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to pay for fabric that she will use to make school uniforms. This way she will complete the uniforms and employ more people to help her. Her idea is to set up her own workshop, so that she can grow and increase the number of customers.

loans.use: To buy fabric that she will use to make school uniforms.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is a farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She is a married woman and the mother of seven grown children. 

Josefa is asking for a loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm. With this, she will be able to improve their farm and its harvest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Sandra Aracely

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 33 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de ganado y especies menores, desde la edad de los 20 años de edad; lo aprendió de sus padres, ya que desde pequeña le enseñaron diferentes oficios para ganarse la vida. Posee tres vacas lecheras las que le sirven para alimentar a sus hijos. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, debe de caminar durante veinte minutos para llegar a la carretera y después aborda dos microbuses hasta llegar a la ciudad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar abono, herbicidas y foliares para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz para alimentar a su familia. Con las ganancias espera reparar su vivienda antes que inicie la época lluviosa y afecte a su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is 33 years old, married, and has two children.  She makes a living through agriculture; raising cattle and small animals, and has done so since she was 20 years old.  She learned it from her parents because at a young age they taught her different jobs in order to earn a living.  

She has three dairy cows that help to feed her children.  In order to buy farming supplies she has to walk 20 minutes to get to the road and then boards a minibus to get to the city.  The loan that she is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy manure, herbicides, and leaf fertilizer to plant her 7,000 square meters of corn to feed her family.  With the earnings she hopes to repair her home before the rainy season begins and affects her family.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, and leaf fertilizers to plant her 7,000 square meters of corn to feed her family.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua has a small business; she sells ladies and men's clothing, which she has done for three years.  She is married to a mason, and has two children. 

Efua uses her income to assist her husband in paying their children’s school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase more ladies and men's clothing to sell.

The profit from her expanded business will help Efua will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies and men's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 66 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Angeles is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Angeles has been raising pigs for 12 years, and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: El Gran Esfuerzo 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Edicto owns a grocery store. He is a member of the El Gran Esfuerzo ("the great effort") 1, 2 & 3 Group located in the city of Hato Mayor, a primarily agricultural region. It is one of the most rural cities in the Dominican Republic. This group is dedicated mostly to people in the door-to-door business, vending their products on foot in different communities.

Edicto is the hard-working father of six children. He lives with his wife and two of their children; the others are living in their own homes, and some reside in Haiti. He tells us that his biggest challenge is to finish building the family house, and he is still saving his business profits toward this goal. With this loan, he will invest in his business by purchasing products for daily meals to sell like rice, flour, vegetables, meat, cooking oil, some other grocery products; these kinds of businesses are called 'Colmado'.

Edicto is very excited to receive his 13th loan through Esperanza Internacional, after having successfully repaid his previous loan. He has had this business for about eight years. He started the business using the first loan he received from us. His dream is to finish construction on his house and to live quietly in it with his family.

loans.use: To buy rice, flour, vegetables, meat, cooking oil, and some other grocery products.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy materials and begin her home's construction

loans.name: Mentor

texts.en:
Mentor, 36, has been working construction for a very long time; he earns a very low salary. He is married, father of two children, and his wife is a house wife.

In order to cut family expenses, he also keeps milk cows.  He sold the cow he had previously, to meet the needs of his family.  Now he needs a loan to buy another milk cow.The loan will help him cut expenses for milk and milk products. 

In the future, he hopes to further expand his farm and increase the number of cows he owns.  His goal is to improve the life of his family. 

He thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Mujeres Progresando 1, 2, 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is one of the members of the Grupo Mujeres Progresando 1, 2, & 3, made up of 15 micro-business owners. They all work selling clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc. Elizabeth is very excited to be receiving her 8th loan from Esperanza Internacional, after having paid off her previous loan satisfactorily and taken a step towards business growth. She has had her business selling shoes for around four years. She started the business with her own resources. 

Elizabeth is planning to invest her new loan in the purchase of different shoe brands and styles for women, men and kids. She is going to use her earnings to continue to reinvest in her business and provide for her family's needs. With her previous loans, she started increasing her sales and savings. 

She is dreaming of having an improved business and of living tranquilly in a safe home with her family. She tells us that her most difficult challenge was to establish her business. She loves to watch television and to be at home with her children. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Blenda

texts.en:
Blenda is 47 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Blenda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Blenda has been farming vegetables for six years and also earns additional income from a general store and raising livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome is a 24-year-old, hard-working man, with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

For three years, he has been selling beers and sodas and with the proceeds he has been able to pay school fees for his child. Like most traders, he has the challenges of price fluctuation and inadequate capital to meet the demand. His dreams are to own a depot and to educate his child to attain a degree, as minimum qualification. 

Jerome intends to use the loan to buy beers and sodas to sell.

loans.use: to buy beers and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. They live in San Miguel, Bohol. 

Vilma, together with her husband, has been in the rice farming business for more than 18 years. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides. With this, they will be able to improve their farm and eventually, its harvest. 

Vilma dreams of expanding their farm in order to generate the additional income necessary for the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Houndoda

texts.fr: Marié à une couturière mr Houndoda âgé de 27ans est tapissier de profession. A la fin de son apprentissage, il a ouvert son atelier afin de rendre service à ses clients. Aidé par 03 personnes, il sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter des matières premières. Le profit tiré de la vente l’aidera à créer d’autres ateliers et arriver à subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Il a une ancienneté de 04ans et père d’un enfant d’un an.
texts.en: Married to a clothier, Mr. Houndoda, aged 27, is an upholsterer by trade. At the end of his apprenticeship, he opened his workshop to provide services to his customers. Assisted by three persons, he is requesting an initial loan to purchase some raw materials. The profit derived from the sales will help him to create other workshops and to be able to meet family needs. He has four years of seniority and is the father of a 1-year-old child.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn, 26 years old, is married to a technician, and blessed with two children.She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost three years. With this business, she's earning a net income of 3,000 PHP a month. 

She would like to get a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase canned goods, coffee, milk, sugar, and beverages. 

She's hoping that her store will become more profitable so that she can increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods, coffee, milk, sugar, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 30-year-old, married man, father of two children. He has been working as a butcher for 17 years. He was only 13 years old when he started working to help his parents in making their living and covering their expenses. In 2009, Ali opened his own butchery and he is very proud of himself because of this step forward towards improving his family's living.

Ali is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, in order to increase his business capital and to buy necessary house needs. He will paint his house after the slight damages done from the winter season.

Ali is well-known in his region, with his clean butchery and the good quality of products he sells. He is working hard to update his business and keep up with his customers' needs and requests.

loans.use: to increase his business capital and to buy necessary house needs.

loans.name: Kotankègnè Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kotankègnè est constitué de dix femmes majoritairement mariées dans les familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Ouolobougouni dans la commune de Konodimini, Région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font le petit commerce de lait de toutes sortes et dérivés. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe intègrent au programme crédit de  Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 1ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame,  Sirantou  (femme debout en 2ème  position de la  gauche  vers la droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de lait dans le village de Ouolobougouni et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 250 litres de lait avec les éleveurs de la localité. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée  d’hommes et de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame,  Sirantou   espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité afin d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Kotankègnè comprises ten women who are married for the most part in monogamous families. The women average 43 years of age and five children each, all living in the village of Ouolobougouni, in Commune de Konodimini, in Région de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women have small-scale businesses involving milk of all sorts and products. 

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are now on their first solidarity loan cycle. 

Ms. Sirantou (the woman standing second from the left in the photo) is a major seller of milk in and around the village of Ouolobougouni. She intends to use her loan to purchase 250 liters of milk from livestock farmers in town. The sales are made in cash or on credit to a customer base composed of men and women. 

With this loan, Ms. Sirantou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business in order to help out her husband meeting the needs of the family.

loans.use: to purchase cow's milk

loans.name: Limaya

texts.en:
Limaya is 36 years old, married and has four children to feed and send to school. Her husband is a farmer.

To make living, Limaya has a retail business (groceries, or sari-sari store). She sells various items in their village like soap, toothpaste, and other basic needs for household use. 

Limaya wants to sell products that are difficult to find in their village; these are costly, but in demand for household use. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, drinks, and powdered milk to sell. 

Limaya is looking forward to having a successful business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, drinks, and powdered milk to sell.

loans.name: Romela

texts.en:
Romela is 39 years old and married, with four children, one of whom is in school.

Romela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more items, like shampoo, noodles, sugar, and other groceries.

Romela has borrowed and paid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 15 years and also earns an income from selling frozen foods and pig-fattening.

Romela aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items, like shampoo, noodles, sugar, and other groceries.

loans.name: Jose Bitelio

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir  más  en capital de trabajo, ya que le genera favorable entradas de dinero. Este le permitirá comprar cerdos  para engordarlos, así mismo concentrado y posteriormente venderlos.
Las circunstancias familiares han mejorado y también las condiciones económicas, ya que ha logrado obtener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
José is requesting a new loan to invest more in working capital because it generates a good income for him.  This will allow him to buy pigs to fatten then sell, as well as concentrated feed.

His family circumstances and economic situation have improved because he has managed to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy pigs and concentrated feed

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is driven mother of one who has patiently managed her business for three years. She started her business with PHP 4,000, a small amount of capital. When she earned a profit, she decided to expand her business by selling more products to her costumers. 

Many of her costumer’s demands are not met because Rosemarie doesn't have enough capital to purchase the products that they want. Therefore, Rosemarie is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy grocery items like noodles, toothpaste, and soap to sell. She hopes to respond immediately to her customer's demand and also increase her income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like noodles, toothpaste, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es: Don Gilberto tiene 53 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos. El se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace muchos años. Junto a sus hijos siembra variedad de cultivos como: maíz, y repollos. Siempre busca la forma de sacarle provecho a sus tierras ya que es la única fuente de ingresos con la que cuenta. De esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar, Gilberto solicita un credito ya que desea invertir en abonos e insecticidas para los cultivos y asi tener mejores cosechas y seguir dandole el sustento diario a su familia.
texts.en:
Gilberto, 53, lives with his wife and three children.  He has made a living in agriculture for many years.  He and his children grow a variety of crops such as corn and cabbage.

He's always looking for ways to make his land productive because it's his only source of income.  This way he earns a living and supports his household.

Gilberto's requesting a loan to invest in soil amendments and insecticide for his crops to have better harvest and continue supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 47 years old, married, and has two children. One of her children attends school.  Marilou works very hard to provide for her family.

Marilou runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Marilou has been in this business for 23 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to ensure financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Besnik

texts.en:
Besnik is 24 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in the Ashkali community and his wife is a housewife. Besnik works at a private company in the garden as a flower planter. His salary is very low and is not enough to cover the family's daily expenses and much-needed home renovations. The family's house is extremely old and in poor condition, which exposes the family to unsanitary and unhealthy living conditions. 

Besnik is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy new windows for the renovation of his home to ensure healthier and improved living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase new windows

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 64-year-old widow. She has owned a grocery store since 2004 where she sells basic home consumption goods, like basic grains, snacks, soft drinks, and frozen items. 

Fatima is a very hard-working, responsible woman. She started the business with her own little money after her husband passed away, aiming at improving her household income, which has, in fact, been improving, especially after the two previous loans she had from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, that were invested in developing her business.

Fatima is applying for a loan from Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development to invest in working capital and to stock her grocery store to meet customer demand because it’s been growing and she wants to offer her customers a variety of products, especially spring and summer beverages.

Fatima hopes to keep on expanding her business and responding to customers' requests.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise, including special spring and summer beverages.

loans.name: Prel's Group

texts.en:
Prel is 38 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three children in a rural area, located in the Dambae district, Cambodia. 

To make a living, she has been growing cassava on one hectare of farmland. To supplement the income, her husband also works for others for a fee, to better support his family. Having been in this business for eight years, Prel earns about KHR 46,000 per day to feed the family; she manages to save about KHR 8,700 each day. 

This is the first loan for Prel with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Prel will use part of her loan to buy pesticides for her farmland and will use a portion of it to pay labor fees. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and earn more income, to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her farmland and to pay labor fees.

loans.name: Melinde

texts.en:
Melinde is 48 years old, married and has four children.  Two of her children are in school. 

Melinde is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

Melinde has been raising livestock for 12 years, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Melinde would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and impact the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es:
MARCO TULIO
DON MARCO TULIO ES UN JOVEN ENTUSIASTA CON GANAS DE LUCHAR Y SALIR ADELANTE, DESDE HACE MAS DE CINCO AÑOS JUNTO A SU PADRE SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE DULCES TIPICOS COMO COCO, AYOTE, CHILACAYOTE, CAMOTE, PEPITA Y ASI MUCHAS BOQUITAS QUE SON DEL GUSTO DE MUCHA GENTE. EL PRODUCTO LO ELABORAN  Y VENDEN EN LA LOCALIDAD Y TAMBIEN MANDAN AL EXTRANJERO. DON MARCO TULIO SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE AZUCAR, PANELA EN DULCE, Y MATERIALES PARA ELABORAR LOS DULCES. ESPERA QUE LE PUEDAN AYUDAR CON EL CREDITO,YA QUE SERIA DE UNA GRAN AYUDA PARA SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Marco Tulio is an enthusiastic young man who wants to strive and get ahead.

For more than five years he and his father have earned a living making traditional candies with products such as coconut, pumpkin, squash, sweet potato, and seeds--snacks that many people like.  They make the products and sell them in town as well as abroad.

Marco Tulio's requesting the loan to buy sugar, brown sugar, and materials to make the candy.

He hopes for help with the loan because it will be a big help to his business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, brown sugar, and materials to make traditional candies

loans.name: Sakhorn's Group

texts.en: Sakhorn is a 51-year-old mother of five children who lives in a rural village in Cambodia's Dambae district. To make a living, she and her husband have been planting cassava on two hectares of farmland for the last 10 years. Her husband supplements the family’s income by working for others for a fee. Sakhorn earns about 25,000 KHR a day and is applying for her fourth loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She also now leads a two-person loan group, and will use her portion of this loan to plow her field and hire people to help do it. She hopes this loan will allow her to earn a larger income so that she and her family can have a better life.

loans.use: to plow her farm.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with two children who operates a retail shop for  survival. Her major business challenge is a small capital base that has always made her customers go without getting everything they may be in need of.

Christine is a third time borrower of UGAFODE Micro finance (MDI), and she is now applying for a loan of ugx.1,000,000/=. 

She applied for the loan purposely to expand her retail shop, and to pay registration fees for her two children who are candidates. 

Christine’s future plans are educating her children and graduating into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To buy retail stock items.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es: Doña reina es comerciante, vive con sus 6 hijo en casa propia y elabora antojitos (papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, etc) que vende de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza han logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña reina pide financiamiento para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboracion de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maiz para los tamales, platanos y todo los ingredientes para su elaboracion y asi poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y porder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en:
Reina is a vendor.  She lives with her six children in her own house.

She makes snacks (fried potatoes, fried yucca, empanadas, tamales, etc.) that she sells on foot near her house.  Thanks to her sales she has managed to pay for her household expenses.

Reina's requesting a loan to buy products she uses to make her snacks, including oil, potatoes, corn for the tamales, bananas, and other ingredients.  This way she'll be able to continue supporting her household and cover the household expenses that might come up.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is a 51-year-old married woman and the mother of seven children from Bien Unido, Bohol. Together with her husband, she has had a dried fish vending business for more than ten years. She also runs a sari-sari, or variety store business.

Lucita is asking for a loan to buy more fish to dry and sell. With this loan, Lucita will be able to augment her stock thus enabling her to sell more dried fish to the people in their area. 

In the future, Lucita hopes to make their business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to dry and sell.

loans.name: Erika Lissette

texts.es:
Erika, requiere de un nuevo préstamo para invertir en el negocio que posee, ya que los préstamos son una fuente positiva para generar ingresos. Este le permitirá comprar churros, sodas, dulces, maíz, frijol, arroz, entre otros productos para surtir la mercadería. 
El crédito anterior le permitió mejorar su negocio, aumentar  la clientela y con ello incrementar las ventas. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado y asimismo las circunstancias familiares.
texts.en:
Erika needs a new loan to invest in her business because the loans are a positive source for generating income.  This will allow her to buy chips, soda, sweets, corn, beans, rice, and other products to stock her merchandise.

The previous loan allowed her to improve her business and increase her customers and, as a result, her sales.  Her economic conditions and her family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy chips, soda, sweets, corn, beans, rice, and other products

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Nuevo Horizonte está en su ciclo número 8º del programa de comité de mujeres, todas ellas han trabajado con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación para ir pasando cada uno de los ciclos.
Mercedes es una de las integrantes y un gran ejemplo de lucha, ya que ella se dedica a la recolección y venta de artículos de reciclaje, también comenta que ella suele comprar los artículos y los revende y de esa forma tiene una mejor ganancia. Ella cuenta que todos los días recorre buscando artículos de plástico, cartón, aluminio y demás y de esa forma se gana la vida. Esta muy orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo digno y por sobre todo muy honesto.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cartones, aluminio, plásticos y demás para poder revenderlos y así tener una pequeña utilidad para seguir ayudando a su familia. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues la ayudará muchísimo.
texts.en:
The group named “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) is in its eighth loan cycle as part of the Women’s Committee Program. The members have worked with great effort and dedication through each of the loan cycles.

Mercedes is one of the members of the group who is a role model of determination. She collects and sells recyclable items. Mercedes says that she usually buys the items and then resells them, thus allowing her to earn more profit. She says that every day she goes out looking for items made of plastic, cardboard, aluminum, and other materials so that she can make a living. Mercedes is very proud of what she does since it is decent and honest work.

She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of cardboard, aluminum, plastics, and other materials that she can resell. This will generate a small profit that will enable her to continue supporting her family. Mercedes is grateful for the opportunity she has received since it will be a great help.

loans.use: to buy cardboard, aluminum, plastics, and other materials that can be resold.

loans.name: Ankadignongné Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Ankadignongné sont mariés majoritairement dans des familles monogamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village Zenguela dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage, de voisinage et de parenté. Elles font le petit commerce de pagnes wax, des produits artisanaux et du lait. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso  et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame, Djelika (femme assise au milieu de la photo) est une grande vendeuse de produits artisanaux dans le village de Zenguela et ses environnants.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  des produits artisanaux (des abreuvoirs en terre cuite pour la volaille, des canaris, gargoulettes et des passoires). Elle se ravitaille en ces produits avec les femmes forgerons du village. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement femmes. Avec ce prêt, Madame  Djelika espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 21 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer l’entretien des enfants.
texts.en: The five members of the Ankadignongné group are married and living mainly in monogamous families.  On the average, they are 38 years of age, with four children each. They all live in the village of Zenguela, Ségou Region (the fourth administrative district ofMali) and know each as relatives by blood or marriage or as neighbors. They sell traditional “pagnes” wax fabric, artisanal products and milk. With the goal of expanding their working capital, the group members have joined Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second solidarity loan. Mrs. Djelika (the one seated in the middle on the photo) is a well-known vendor of artisanal products in the village of Zenguela and nearby region. She plans to use her loan to buy artisanal products (terracotta water troughs for poultry, small vessels, pots and colanders). She buys these products from the village blacksmiths. She resells for cash and on credit to a customer base composed mainly of women. With this loan, Mrs. Djelika hopes to achieve an average monthly income of 21,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her activity and help provide for her children’s needs.

loans.use: to buy artisanal products.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 52 years old, married, and has three children. 

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.  Lucila has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards attaining her dream-to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ran

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Phnom Proek district where farming is a common way to make a living, Ran is a 55-year-old mother of one child. Rice farming, corn and cassava planting are the main sources of her family’s income. She and her husband have been farming for 13 years. The current business earns them about US$7 per day and they manage to save about US$5 each day after daily expenses.
This is the third microloan for Ran with Kiva’s partner and she completely paid back the past loan. Ran has successfully used the loan to better support her family. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her cultivated land. She hopes to increase her crop production and to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds for her cultivated land

loans.name: Phan's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Dambae district where farming is a common way to earn a living, Phan is age 39 and married. She and her husband have struggled to feed the family by growing cassava and selling grocery items in the village. She and her husband have been in these businesses for 10 years.
Phan has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five loans and she completely paid back the loans. Her group members have been with VisionFund for from four to six loans. The past loans have helped Phan to relieve her family’s burden. Now she is leading her group of three to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to plow the field and use a portion of it to spend on buying more grocery items to resell. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income so as to better her living condition.

loans.use: To plow the field for farming and to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Elda Martha

texts.es:
La Sra. Elda, vive en Piedras Negras desde hace 28 años, es una de las hijas más pequeñas de 7 hermanos, ella junto a sus hermanos son muy unidos y apegados a las necesidades de su madre, ya que desde hace 20 años su padre los abandono.
A pesar de esto ellos son muy buenos hijos y siempre están al pendiente de su madre.
La Sra. Elda pide apoyo através de KIVA para pintar su casa para que así luzca más agradable y bonita al momento que llegan a visitarla, también para las reuniones familiares que hacen los fines de semana, se encuentra muy deteriorada la pintura con la que cuenta su casa, pero con este apoyo podrá lograr su proyecto y se sentirá más cómoda en cuanto a la apariencia de su hogar.
texts.en:
Sra. Elda has been living in Piedras Negras for 28 years. She is one of the younger daughters among her seven siblings. Elda is very close with her siblings and they are sensitive to the needs of their mother, who was abandoned by their father 20 years ago.

Sra. Elda is requesting support from Kiva so that she can paint her house in order to give it a pleasant and nice appearance for when others come to visit, especially for family gatherings on the weekends. The existing paint on the house is in a deteriorated condition. With this loan, Elda can complete her project and feel more comfortable with the appearance of her home.

loans.use: to paint her house.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Don Roberto de 43 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de los principales granos básicos como maíz, frijoles y maicillo, Año  con año realiza la misma actividad de preparar la tierra, sembrar los granos básicos, y cosechar los frutos de sus cultivos. Después de sacar la cosecha la pone a la venta en los principales puntos de venta de su lugar de residencia. De esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar y es así como ha logrado mantener a su familia por mucho tiempo. Don Roberto solicita un credito para invertir en los insumos agrícolas: abonos, semillas, insecticidas, etc. necesarios para la obtención de una buena cosecha y poder lograr su sueño de dar a su familia lo mejor y poder lograr estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Roberto, 43, makes a living growing the main basic grains such as corn, beans, and sorghum.  Year to year he does the same work to prepare the land, plant basic grains, and harvest the fruit of his crops.  After harvesting the crop he sells it in the main commercial areas where he lives.  This is how he supports his family, which he has been able to do for a long time.

Roberto's requesting a loan to invest in the necessary agricultural supplies (soil amendments, seed, insecticide, etc.) to have a good harvest and be able to realize his dream--to give his family the best and achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en: Jihad is 33 years old, married and the father of two children. He adores his family and works closely with his wife to pay all their many expenses so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Jihad started his own business providing car repairs 16 years ago. He works out of his own garage and has a fair number of customers who come to him for service. He is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua to increase his supply of car batteries so that he can respond quickly to customer needs. This will be Jihad's second loan with Al Majmoua. He is a member in good standing because he made all his payments on time. He plans to expand his business with the additional income he earns.

loans.use: to buy car batteries for his business.

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Living in a rural area, located in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Lang is 53 years old and married. She has eight children, two of whom are dependent on her and are still in school. 

To make a living, Lang has been planting rubber and cassava for almost thirty years. Her family’s daily income is about KHR 40,000 per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Lang received her first loan, one cycle ago, and she completely paid back the loan. The past loan from VisionFund Cambodia has helped her family to significantly improve their living conditions. 

Now, she is requesting a loan of KHR 3,000,000 to plow the field, to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland, and to buy a bowl to extract the rubber. She hopes this loan will help her to increase her income from the current business, so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to plow the field, to buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland, and to buy a bowl to extract rubber.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity sells cooking utensils in Jukwa near Cape Coast. Charity has gone to school through junior high school. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a driver. Charity has been selling sauce pans and other cooking utensils for four years. She uses her income to help support her husband in the general upkeep of their home. Charity will use her loan to purchase more cooking utensils to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking utensils to sell.

loans.name: Poy

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Dambae district, Poy is age 27 and married with one daughter. The main source of her family’s income is from cassava which she has grown for five years to make a living. For more income, her husband works as a paid worker in the local area. Together, they can earn approximately 20,000 KHR per day for the future needs.
Poy has just joined VisionFund for this loan. She is asking for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy pesticides and plow the field and also spend on labor.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to get a high crop yield from her cassava growing so she can sell it for a good price.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and to pay for plowing the field.

loans.name: Samorn's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Dambae district, Samorn is 24 years old and married with two children. She has grown cassava on two hectares of farmland for four years while her husband is a construction worker. Together, she and her husband currently earn about 31,000 KHR per day.  
This is the second microloan for Samorn with Visionfund while her group member has been with VisionFund for three loans. The first loan has helped Samorn to better support her family. Now, she and her group member are applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR each through VisionFund. As the leader, Samorn is going to use her portion to buy pesticides and plow the field and use a portion of it for labor fees. She also wants to grow rubber trees to earn additional income for the family. With this loan, she hopes to grow her cassava healthfully and sell it for a good price to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and plow the field.

loans.name: Kimyan's Group

texts.en:
Kimyan, 62 years old, is married and has four children. He lives with his wife in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. 

He and his wife earn a living through planting cassava on two hectares of farmland and rubber trees on one hectare of farmland. Together, they can earn about KHR 62,000 per day from the current business and manage to save about KHR 25,000 each day, after offsetting expenses.

Kimyan’s Group consists of two members who live in the same area and they are both in their second cycle with VisionFund Cambodia. The past loan that Kimyan successfully paid back has helped his family to support his business and improve his living conditions. 

Now leading this group to apply for a loan, Kimyan, who is the leader, will use a portion of his loan to buy a bowl for extracting the rubber and a portion to spend on plowing the field. He hopes to increase his family’s income, to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a bowl to extract rubber and to plow the field.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a 54-year-old farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a widow and has four children. Marina is also engaged in food-vending business, selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her place. 

Marina is asking for a loan to buy flour, baking powder, cooking oil, butter, and also fertilizer for the farm. 

In the future, Marina hopes of expanding her business, so that it will generate the income necessary for the needs of the family. She also wants to save money for the repayment of her loan.

loans.use: to buy flour, baking powder, cooking oil, and butter for her food-vending business and also fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is married and has three children.  She lives in Jukwa near Cape Coast. Her husband is a driver.  Sarah cooks plain rice and serves it with meat and tomatoes sauce, which she has been doing for seven years.  Sarah supports her husband in paying their accommodation bills. 

Sarah is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase bags of rice, fish, and other ingredients needed to prepare the food she sells. With the new profit, she hopes to establish a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, fish, and other ingredients

loans.name: Khat's Group

texts.en: Khat is 20 years old and married. She lives with her husband and one son in a rural area of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She and her husband have been growing cassava on two hectares of farmland. They have been in this business for five years, and earn about KHR 27,000 per day. Khat leads a four-person group that is applying for a loan from Kiva partner VisionFund. She will use her portion of this loan to buy pesticides for her farmland and  plow her field. She hopes to grow her business and have a larger harvest so that she and her family can have a better life.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for a farm.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 46 years old and a coffee farmer in Kyarwera. He earns additional income from local brewing, free range poultry farming, and bee keeping. 

Stephen is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy fertilizers for his coffee plantation. He has already paid his children’s school fees, built a house, and acquired land for future use of his family when he reaches old age.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Sinat is 50 years old and married, with two children, both of whom are dependents and are still in school. 

The main sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and cassava planting. Her husband works as a paid worker in the local area to earn additional income for the family. Sinat and her husband have been in this business for ten years. With the current business, she can earn about KHR 16,000 per day. 

This is the fourth loan for Sinat with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund Cambodia and she completely paid back the previous loans. She successfully used the past loan to improve her livelihood. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund Cambodia of KHR 1,400,000 each, Sinat is going to use a portion of her loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and a portion to spend on labor. She hopes to increase her crop yield and to sell it for a good price, so as to keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en: Saumu lives in the Mariakani area of the Coast province in Kenya. She owns a retail business where she sells fish to help support her six children.  She began her work life by helping a friend sell fish, then went into business for herself after learning the trade. Her main challenge is spoilage and perishability, and she looks forward to solving this problem by acquiring a freezer. Saumu was introduced to Milango by her friends and now is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to buy a freezer. She will use the extra income made possible by this loan to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for storing fresh fish.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe, solicita un nuevo préstamo  porque este financiamiento es de mucha ayuda para sacar cosechas más abundantes; este lo invertirá en pago de mano de obra para realizar la preparación de una manzana de tierra en donde sembrar maíz, asimismo le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas para realizar la siembra. 
El crédito anterior lo invirtió en granos básicos y le genero muchos resultados, ya que incremento la cosecha.  Las circunstancias familiares han mejorado gracias a los ingresos que ha logrado obtener, lo único que un hijo tuvo un accidente y falleció pero aun así ha luchado mucho para seguir trabajando con la institución.
texts.en:
Felipe is requesting a new loan because this loan will be of great help to produce more abundant harvests.  He will invest it in paying labor costs to prepare a ‘manzana’ [Central American unit of land measurement] of land to plant corn.  It will also make it possible for him to buy manure, herbicide, fungicide and insecticide to do his planting.

He used his previous loan to buy basic grains and had good results because he increased his crop yield.  His family circumstances have improved thanks to the income he was able to earn.  The only thing is that his son suffered a fatal accident; even so however, he continues striving much to continue working with the institution.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
Las 14 integrantes de este grupo trabajan y se ayudan las unas a las otras, es un grupo muy unido que es conocido en todo el barrio por trabajar siempre juntas. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual les ayuda a saber cuáles son sus ingresos. Y ha mostrado que la mayoría de ellas se encuentran con un ingreso medio, es decir, ni muy bajo ni muy alto.
 Sergia, quien es parte de este grupo cuenta lo difícil que esta la vida, y que la única forma de salir adelante es trabajando duro y con mucha entrega. Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas de todo tipo, y que en general le va muy bien ya que siempre está bien surtida. Cuenta que le gustaría además poder seguir mejorando sus ingresos y estar ayudando de mejor manera así a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de gaseosas, cervezas, vinos, energizantes y demás para tener un buen stock de ellos y seguir dándolo a su familia.
texts.en:
The 14 members of this group work together and help one another. They are a unified group that is known throughout their neighborhood for always working together. The members are taking a poverty elimination survey, which helps them become familiar with the income they are earning. Most of them have demonstrated that they earn a moderate income, in other words, not too low or not too high.

Sergia, a member of this group, says that she has had a difficult life. The only way she knows how to get ahead is to work hard and with great dedication. Sergia sells beverages of all types. In general, she has done very well and always remains well-stocked. She says that she would like to continue improving her income so that she can help her family the best way she can.

Sergia is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of sodas, beer, wine, energy drinks, and other products in order to remain well-stocked with these items. As a result, she can continue providing for her family.

loans.use: to buy sodas, beer, wine, energy drinks, and other products.

loans.name: Vibol's Group

texts.en: Vibol lives in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. She is 31 years old and the mother of four children, all of whom depend on her and are still in school. She and her husband earn a living by growing cassava on two hectares of farmland. This is the family's main source of income. She and her husband have been in this line of work for almost five years and earn about 19,000 KHR per day. Vibol leads a two-person loan group, and is applying for her second loan with VisionFund. She successfully paid back the first loan, which helped her improve her life. She plans to use her portion of this loan to buy pesticides for her farmland and plow her field. She hopes to grow a healthier, larger crop as a way to improve her family's life.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de  incrementar  y fortalecer más su negocio, ya que los créditos son una fuente de financiamiento favorable que generan mayores ingresos.  Este le permitirá comprar churros, bebidas, arroz, frijol, azúcar, sal, entre otros productos.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a crecer en el negocio, tener un mayor reconocimiento en la zona y obtuvo mayores ingresos.  Las circunstancias familiares han mejorado y así mismo las condiciones económicas.
texts.en:
José requests a new loan because he needs to strengthen and increase his business more since loans are a favorable source of financing that lead to higher income.  This one will make it possible for him to buy packaged snacks, beverages, rice, beans, sugar and salt, among other products.

The previous loan helped his business to grow and to become better known in the zone; he earned higher income.  His family circumstances as well as his economic conditions have improved.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.es: Don Gustin de 38 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijo en casa propia, es un hombre muy responsable, trabajador y honrado, trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan dulce, y sale a venderlo por la colonia donde el reside solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de harina, manteca, latas, para poder darle amntenimiento al horno que muestra en la fotografia y todo lo necesario para poder producir más. Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su panadería es muy importante para el puesto que así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Gustin, 38, lives with his wife and two children in his own house; he’s a very responsible, hardworking, honest man.  He works in his own bakery making sweet bread that he then goes out to sell throughout his neighborhood.  He’s requesting a loan to buy flour, shortening and baking tins and to service the oven shown in the photograph as well as everything else needed to produce more.  This bakery improvement project is very important to him because it will improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: Dúo Vencedoras Por Fe Group

texts.es:
DUO VENCEDORAS POR FE
LA SEÑORA MARIA INES DE 45 AÑOS DE EDAD ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE COMIDA ELLA VIVE EN CHIMALTENANGO, DIA  A DIA  POR LAS TARDES O CASI NOCHES EMPIEZA A TRABAJAR ELABORANDO SUS DIFERENTES PLATILLOS DE COMIDA PARA LA VENTA LUEGO A LAS CUATRO DE LA MAÑANA PREPARAN SUS COSAS Y SALEN A TOMAR EL BUS PARA VIAJAR A LA CAPITAL YAQUE EN LA CAPITAL ELLAS TIENE UN LUGAR DONDE SE COLOCAN PARA VENDER SU COMIDA Y REFACCIONES QUE PREPARAN ESTO LO HACEN TODOS LOS DIAS. EL DESEO DE ELLAS ES LUCHAR Y AHORRAR PARA PODER COMPRAR UN VEHICULO PARA TRANSPORTARSE MAS FACIL MENTE A SU LUGAR DE TRABAJO, ESTA SOLICITANDO SU CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS COMESTIBLES PARA LA EALBORACION DE COMIDAS Y REFACCIONES PARA LA VENTA.
texts.en:
“Vencedoras por Fe” (Triumphant in Faith) Duo

María Inés, 45, works selling food.  She lives in Chimaltenango.  Every day in the evening or almost at night she starts working making various dishes to sell.  At four in the morning they get their things ready and go out to take a bus to travel to the capital because that’s where they have a food stand set up to sell the food and snacks they prepare; they do this every day.  Their wish is to strive and save in order to buy a vehicle to transport themselves to their place of work more easily.  She’s requesting her loan to buy ingredients to make the food and refreshments to sell.

loans.use: to buy food preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Don Jorge vive con sus esposa y sus 4 hijos en cas propia, es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos loa años los principales granos básicos como lo son, maíz y frijol. Jorge desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Jorge lives with his wife and four children in his own home. He is a very responsible man with his home obligations since he has always been characterized as providing the best to his children. He has always done so with joy and enthusiasm. 

He works in agriculture. Each year, he plants all of the major grains, such as corn and beans. Jorge wishes to increase his sales, and so is requesting a loan which will allow him to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, and pesticides, among others. He would like to count on the help requested since he does not have any other monetary income, and so he will continue bringing the daily bread to his home without any limitation.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Rafael está en su ciclo 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza el cual les ayudará a saber en qué situación económica están, donde hay varias señoras que se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Rosalina, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.  Entre el trabajo que ella hace es la cría animales de la casa para su comercialización, también se debe destacar el trabajo y el esfuerzo que ella está haciendo para ir mejorando su economía y la de su familia. Es una persona que quiere trabajar, crecer y salir adelante.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de mas animales, como ser cerdos, gallinas, pavos y demás, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named “San Rafael” is in its second loan cycle as part of the Women’s Committee Program. All of them are working with the program so that they can help one another get ahead. The members are taking a poverty elimination survey, which helps them become familiar with their financial situation. Several of these women are below the poverty line. In other words, their incomes are very low.

One of these women is Sra. Rosalina. Her latest survey demonstrated that she was at a poverty level within Level 1, which indicates that her income is very low. The work she does includes raising animals at home which she can sell. It should be pointed out that her work and her efforts will help improve her financial situation and that of her family. Rosalina is a person who wants to work, grow, and move forward.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more animals such as pigs, chickens, turkeys, and other livestock. This will help her follow through with her business plan to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy pigs, chickens, turkeys, and other animals.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elías, se dedica a la agricultura, siembra de granos básicos  y ganadería, este trabajo lo inicia como fuente de ayuda para la familia y gastos del hogar, lo lleva a cabo de las 4:00 am a 4:00 pm. Elías, vive con su compañera de vida y tiene una hija de 8 meses, no recibe ayuda del extranjero.
El préstamo que requiere optar le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas,  semilla para realizar el cultivo de maíz. Este le ayudara a tener una mejor cosecha de maíz, incrementar las ganancias y con ello generar mejores ingresos. 
Su objetivo es ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Elías works in agriculture. He plants basic grains and raises livestock. He began this work as a source of help for the family and home expenses. He works from 4:00 am to 4:00 pm. Elías lives with his life partner and has an 8-month-old daughter. He does not receive outside help.

The loan that he requires will allow him to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, pest-controls, and seeds to be able to cultivate corn. This will allow him to have a better corn harvest, increase his profits, and with them generate a better income.

His objective is to offer a better quality life to his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, pest-controls, and seeds to be able to cultivate corn.

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Pheap, 47, has six children. Pheap and her husband are farmers who grow cassava on one-hectare of farmland. Engaged in this business for nine years, they are able to earn about 20,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Pheap’s group consists of three members who have been with VisionFund for two previous loans, since repaid, which helped Pheap improve her livelihood. She is now leading her group to request a new loan of 1,400,000KHR each. As the leader, she will use her portion to pay for pesticides for her cassava and the plowing of her field.

Pheap hopes this loan will enable her to grow her cassava healthily and in greater quantity to better her family’s living standard.

loans.use: To pay for pesticides for her cassava and the plowing of her field.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras 2 Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Trabajadoras está en el 5to. ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante.  Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se esfuerzan por dar lo mejor a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Adela, ella tiene una librería y fotocopiadora frente a un colegio en su barrio. Hay que destacar que ella es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza al máximo para salir adelante y dar a sus familiares todo lo que necesitan. Su sueño es poder seguir agrandando su local y cada día poder ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de cuadernos, lápices, bolígrafos, libros y demás insumos para poder surtir su negocio con lo que sus clientes solicitan. Agradece por la oportunidad que ellas y sus amigas están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The group named “Mujeres Trabajadoras” (Working Women) is in its fifth loan cycle as part of the Women’s Committee Program. All of them are working with the program so that they can help each other get ahead. These women are the head of their households and are striving to provide the best for their families.

One of the members is Sra. Adela. She has a bookstore and photocopy shop in front of a school in her neighborhood. It should be noted that Adela is a hardworking individual who tries her best to move forward and provide her family with everything they need. Her dream is to continue expanding her shop so that she can offer the greatest variety each day to her customers.

Adela is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of notebooks, pencils, pens, books, and other products. This will enable her to restock her business with items requested by her customers. She is grateful for the opportunity that she and her friends have received.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, pencils, pens, books, and other products.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña Kyrey está en su ciclo número 4º gracias al trabajo que todas ellas hacen, están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza el cual les permite saber el ingreso de cada una de ellas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Julia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro de un nivel bueno, con un buen margen de ingresos, todo esto gracias al trabajo arduo que está haciendo. Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras de todo tipo, siempre tiene bien surtido su puesto con frutas y verduras  frescas de estación y por medio de este trabajo esta saliendo adelante y da a su familia lo que necesitan.
La Sra. Julia Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bananas, naranjas, manzanas y mandiocas, cebollas, etc, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named “Kuña Kyrey” is in its fourth loan cycle, thanks to the work all of them have accomplished. The members are taking a poverty elimination survey, which helps each woman become familiar with her income situation.

One of the members is Sra. Julia. Her latest poverty survey indicated that she was within a good level. This result was due to a good profit margin thanks to all of the hard work she has done. Julia sells fruits and vegetables of all types. She always keeps her stand stocked with fresh seasonal fruits and vegetables. Through her work, Julia is able to move forward and provide her family with what they need.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy bananas, oranges, apples, cassava, onions, and other produce. This will enable her to follow through with her business plan, which will help to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy bananas, oranges, apples, cassava, onions, and other produce.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es:
Moisés, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y crianza de ganado. Él vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos; desde hace unos años atrás realiza el oficio y lo aprendió con su padre, actualmente cultiva 4 manzanas de maíz de lo cual parte de la producción lo utiliza para el consumo familiar y la otro lo vende.
El crédito que requiere lo invertirá en el pago de mozos, prepara la tierra para luego cultivarla, así mismo para comprar herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, abono. Este le ayudara para poder tener una mejor cosecha, los problemas que pueden surgir en la cosecha es q se limita a llover y se seque el cultivo.
texts.en:
Moisés raises corn and livestock.  He lives with his wife and three children and has been farming for several years, a task he learned from his father.  He currently has four plots of corn and uses part of the harvest for his family’s consumption and sells the rest.

He will use the money from this loan to pay field hands to prepare the land in order to subsequently plant on it.  He will also buy herbicides, pest-controls, insecticides, and compost.  This will help his to have a better harvest.  Problems he may continue to have include lack of rain and drying out of his crops.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: M'ndaka

texts.en:
M'ndaka is a farmer who resides in Nkubu. He is married and has four children. He grows coffee, maize, beans, and vegetables. Besides farming, he also has a welding workshop.

M'ndaka requested a loan of KES 50,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to purchase pigs.This will enable him to increase his level of income and, therefore, improve his living standards. 

In the future, M'ndaka plans to open a huge pork-house. Poor weather conditions are his major challenge. He says that Juhudi Kilimo will enable him boost his pork industry.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
