Las 12 integrantes de este grupo son de la ciudad de Caacupé, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se han esforzado al máximo para poder salir adelante y  dar a sus hijos y familiares todo lo que necesitan para poder tener una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Librada es la presidenta del grupo, se dedica a las ventas y cuenta que tiene una pequeña despensa bien equipada, en donde trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día, hasta muy tarde en la noche. Es una persona muy emprendedora que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder surtir su despensa con todo tipo de productos, como ser verduras, carnes, frutas, leche, panificados y demás insumos que son de mucha salida en su negocio. Sabe que por medio de este trabajo podrá seguir trabajando y creciendo.
texts.en:
The 12 members of this group are from the city of Caacupé. These women are the head of their families, so they strive very hard to move forward and provide their children and family members everything they need to have a decent life without feeling deprived.

Librada is the group president. She buys and sells from her small food pantry, which is well-stocked. Librada works every day at her business, beginning in the early morning hours and continuing until very late at night. She is an enterprising individual who has been able to get ahead as a result of her great sacrifice and effort.

Librada is requesting a loan so that she can restock her food pantry with all types of products such as vegetables, meats, fruit, milk, baked goods, and other items that will keep her business in good standing. She knows that this business will allow her to continue working and growing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, fruit, milk, baked goods, and other items.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres emprendedoras es un grupo de la ciudad de Pilar, son 13 mujeres que se han unido con el deseo de poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo de cada una y asi darle a sus hijos lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Regina una de las integrantes, cuenta que vende sabanas de todo tipo, tamaños y calidad, además de eso se dedica a la costura y así se gana la vida de forma honrada. Ella es muy trabajadora y se debe de destacar que pone mucho esfuerzo por salir adelante, aprender cosas nuevas e innovar siempre.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas e hilos de todo tipo, para poder seguir con sus confecciones y cumpliendo a la vez con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) is a group from the city of Pilar. These 13 women have united together because of their desire to help their families. Through their work, they have been able to provide their children with the things they were not able to have.

Regina is one of the members. She sells bed sheets of all types, sizes, and qualities. Regina is also a seamstress, which allows her to make an honest living. She is a very hard worker and has put forth great effort to get ahead. Regina is also willing to learn new things and remain innovative.

She is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of fabric and thread of all types. This will allow her to continue sewing and fulfilling orders for her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en: Ms. Kouser is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of five. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing this for the past three years. She is an expert at the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operating her business, she requested a loan of 15,000 PKR to buy thread in different colors, along with packs of zippers and buttons. Her goal is to meet the increasing demand of her customers. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy thread in different colors, along with packs of zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Ms Najma, 35 years old, is very talented and excels at tailoring. She has a significant client base in her community and earns enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband works as a driver, but his income is not enough to alone meet the needs of the family. Therefore, she started her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation.

In order to meet increasing customer demand, Najma has requested her second loan in the amount of Rs. 20,000 to purchase more spools of threads and packs of needles, buttons and zippers. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family through all of her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads and packs of needles, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Manuel Ramón

texts.es:
Manuel, de 56 años de edad, es músico. Cuenta que desde su infancia aprendió al lado de su padre quien también se dedicó a este oficio. 
Asegura que la música más que una actividad generadora de ingresos, es una parte importante de su vida, ama su trabajo con la misma intensidad que ama a su familia. En la actualidad, debió suspender su negocio debido a que el acordeón con el que contaba se deterioró por uso, razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para comprar uno nuevo, reactivar su trabajo y el de los cuatro compañeros que conforman el conjunto.
Sueña con ser reconocido a nivel nacional y dar a conocer su música en todos los rincones el mundo.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 56-year-old musician. He says he learned music as a child from his father, who was also devoted to this profession.

Manuel says that music is more than a way of earning income; it is part of his life. He loves his work with the same intensity that he loves his family. At the moment, he has had to suspend his business because his accordion wore out with use. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can buy a new one. He will be able to restart his business with his four other band mates who make up his group.

Manuel dreams of becoming recognized on a national level and promoting his music in all corners of the world.

loans.use: to buy an accordion.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Ms. Shahnaz is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of four.  She is striving to meet their needs including food, clothing, and health expenses. Her husband is employed in a small restaurant but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her business of sewing clothes to contribute to the family income. 

Shahnaz is quite familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community.  She requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of buttons and needles etc. Then she will be able to meet the demand of her customers without fail.  She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors as well as packs of buttons and needles, etc.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Ms. Nazia is a 20-year-old married woman. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring  services in her community. She has been doing it for the past six years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  

Nazia earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons, etc. to meet with the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors and packs of zippers, buttons, etc .

loans.name: Kishwar

texts.en: Ms. Kishwar is 53 years old and a married woman. She has been running a beauty parlor for seven years. She very well knows the techniques of make-up and hair styling. By this time she has attained a regular list of customers. To meet with the increasing demand of her customers, she needs to purchase more cosmetics products for her parlor.  That is why she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 25,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater for more customers time after time which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Ms. Zarina is a 41-year-old, married woman and a mother of four. She has been running a business selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. By this time she has become known for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

Zarina requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. 

Zarina dreams of giving a good, quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business. She is in her 7th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season, taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en:
Ms. Mumtaz is 38 years old and a married woman and mother of four.  She has been running a general store for many years. She is doing it with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Mumtaz’s husband.  

Mumtaz is eager to support her family members financially and to provide a better future to her children. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to make her store fully stocked, she needs to purchase a stock of rice and flour as well as packs of pulses and grains. For this reason, she applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to Kashf Foundation. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of rice and flour as well as packs of pulses and grains.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Ms. Asma is a 23-year-old married lady. She has been running a business selling milk for the past seven years. She has five buffaloes and sells their milk to many of her neighbors. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She is a mother of two and is motivated to provide her children a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  

Asma has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. Her husband works as a laborer but earns insufficient income to support the needs of the family members alone. In order to grow her sales, Asma requested a loan of Rs. 35,000 to purchase another buffalo. It would help her to cater for more people of her community. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Ms Salma is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has gained two years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her in dealing with customers. Both are working hard to meet the needs of their seven children. 

Salma wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy packs of salts, biscuits, oil, sugar and beverages to meet the increasing demand in her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, oil, sugar and beverages.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Ms Nusrat is a 57-year-old married woman. She has been manufacturing foot pumice or graters for many years at home which are used for foot cleansing. She makes them with fine mud and sells them to the people of her community. Over time she has gained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family's income. She is a mother of six and is motivated to provide for her family. 

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase a stock of good quality mud and scrub powder to inflate her sales. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to provide good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of good quality mud and scrub powder to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Ms Khalida is a 26-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with the support of her husband at the corner of her house. She has gained five years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of four children; among them three are school-going. 

Khalida is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health care. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy a stock of grains, salt and biscuits along with packs of beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a stock of grains, salt and biscuits along with packs of beverages.

loans.name: Imtyaz

texts.en:
Ms. Imtyaz is a 23-year-old married woman. Her husband does labor for daily wages but his income is not sufficient to bear the family's everyday expenditures alone. In this tough time, Imtyaz decided to help her husband to meet financial expenditures so she initiated a business of milk sales. She feels proud that she is helping her husband to meet their basic needs. 

By this time she has attained a regular list of customers. In order to grow her sales, she needs to purchase another buffalo. For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000. She is in her 5th loan cycle with a good repayment history. Imtyaz dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Ms. Nasreen is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. The man shown in the photo is Nasreen’s husband. They have been working together for many years and make enough to fulfill the basic necessities of life. 

They have four children and are motivated to provide them with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy a stock of rice, flour and sugar at whole sales rates from the market. In this way they can earn more by catering for more customers time after time. Nasreen dreams of providing a better standard of living to her children.

loans.use: to buy a stock of rice, flour and sugar at whole sale rates from the market.

loans.name: Bhaag

texts.en:
Ms. Bhaag is 51 years old and a married woman; she has had a business of milk sales for the past 20 years. Her business is good enough to allow her to lead a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family with good education, food and clothing.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently, she has requested a loan of Rs 25,000 to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. She hopes to get an increase in the production of milk which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Ms. Shabana is 33 years old and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for four years now and is proud to be contributing to her household income. When Shabana was not earning, her family was going through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. Her husband is also a tailor, but due to limited resources neither of their two children was sent to school. 

Shabana felt it obligatory to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. She has established a good clientele but because of low cash in hand, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000. She intends to use this loan amount to purchase a new stitching machine with spools of thread and zippers in various colors. In this way she would be able to cater her customers time after time which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with spools of thread and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Ms Shagufta is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is successfully running a beauty parlor business; she offers many facilities to her customers such as make-up, hair styling and facials. Through her excellent services she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the beauty parlor. But because she has little cash, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. She needs a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She is hopeful that she will be able to cater for more and more customers and will get a boost in her net income.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Ms Rabia is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health care. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand in her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Manzooran

texts.en:
Ms Manzooran is a 56-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. For the past 10 years, Manzooran has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family at a time when her husband was the only bread earner. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. 

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase another milking buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income through her large sales. She is in her second loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another milking buffalo.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Ms Sajida, a widowed mother of three, has been running a clothes-selling business for the past seven years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good-quality products in her community.

Sajida has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of clothing for the summer season that reflects the choices and tastes of her customers, enabling her to earn more income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business.

Sajida dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all of her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes for the summer season that reflects the choices and tastes of her customers.

loans.name: Sumaira

texts.en:
Ms. Sumaira is a 44-year-old married woman and has been running a business manufacturing wooden decorations. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Taking a loan from Kashf helped her account for expenses she thought she could never bear. She is striving to meet her family expenditures. 

Sumaira is responsible for providing her family a good environment with good food, clothing, and education. She needs a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy raw materials such as a stock of good quality wood with packs of paints in various colors. This would help her in attracting more customers. She desires to utilize the earned revenue for building a separate room for her children.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as a stock of good quality wood and packs of paints in various colors.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Ms Rubina is a 32-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She has been doing a tailoring business for two years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of the household and the educational needs of the children. That is why she started tailoring at home so as to support her family better. 

She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Currently, she requested a loan of PKR 15,000 to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons and laces etc. In this way she will be able to meet with the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Robina hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons and laces.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Ms Farida is a 45-year-old married woman. For the past 10 years, she has been successfully running a milk shop where she sells milk and yogurt to the people of her community. Over time, Farida has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Farida’s husband works as a laborer but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members alone. 

Farida is requesting a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves. In this way she will be able to inflate her sales. She dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow and feed for its calves.

loans.name: Shabmam

texts.en:
Ms Shabmam is a 30-year-old married woman and works from home as a tailor. She has been in this line of work for many years and is proud to be contributing to her household's income. When Shabmam was not earning, her family went through a severe financial crisis that compelled her to use her stitching skills in a productive manner. 

Her husband was the sole bread winner of the family, and due to limited resources none of their three sons were sent to school. Shabmam felt it absolutely necessary to change her family’s living standards and started working from home. By now she has established a good clientele, but now a days unable to meet the large orders on time. That’s why she contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advise of her sister. 

Currently she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 and her loan will be used to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and packs of needles.  She is in her fourth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine with some spools of threads and packs of needles.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Ms. Naseem is a 35-year-old married woman; her husband has been doing a business of wristwatch sales for many years. The man shown in the photo is Naseem’s husband; he offers various types of watches in different designs and colors and earns a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

In order to purchase more variety of watches in different sizes and designs, considering the choice of his customers, Naseem contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 20,000. It will help him to grow his sales which ultimately helps in generating more cash. Naseem is in her 2nd loan cycle with a good repayment history and hopes to have a good experience with the new loan.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of watches in different sizes and designs.

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en:
Ms. Ruqia is 29 years old and a married lady and enjoys doing hand embroidery. She started doing this work with her daughters. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her area. Due to increased in demand for her embroidery designs, she is indulging other women with her business. 

Ruqia has two daughter and two sons.  She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs. 15,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater for more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors along with packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Ms. Sajida has been successfully running a business of envelope-making, for the past four years.  She buys scrap paper, and after properly cutting and recycling these papers, she makes envelopes of them. She then sells the envelopes to different shops, for packing. Through her business she makes enough of an income to contribute to the family income.

She has four children, all of them school-going. She is responsible for providing them with good food, health care, and education, so she requires earning more income to support her family well. She is taking her third loan from Kashf Foundation, and she requested a loan of 30,000 PKR. She will use the loan to buy bundles of paper, which will enable her to increase her sales. She expects a boost in her earnings, and she wishes to spend the part of profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of paper, which she will recycle into more new envelopes to sell.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Ms. Shahida is a married woman; she has been manufacturing shoes for the past eight years. She beautifully makes shoes at home and then sells them in the local market. By this time she has acquired a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband also helps her by selling shoes in local market. 

Sahida is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to purchase thread, leather and soles in large quantity to increase her production. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. Shahida wishes to utilize part of her revenues to provide good, quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase thread, leather and soles in large quantity.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Ms. Nasreen, at the age of 48, enjoys doing hand embroidery. She started doing the work with her daughters. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her area. Due to increased in demand for her embroidery designs, she is indulging other women with her business. 

Nasreen has seven children. Her husband is not in good physical shape to support her family. She is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life including food, clothes and education and provide for the marriage of her daughter. In order to meet the growing demand for embroidery, she needs to engage some more women so she requested a loan of Rs.35,000 from Kashf Foundation. In this way she can manage to buy more frames, needles and thread of different colors which will help in generating more income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and thread of different colors.

loans.name: Sega

texts.en:
Ms. Sega is a 31-year-old, married woman and a mother of one child. She has been doing a business of tailoring for the past six years, to support her husband. She has accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household, with the educational needs of their child. That is why she started tailoring at home -- to support her family well. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. She works hard to continually provide income for their family's everyday expenses.

Now, she has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR. She will use the loan to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons and lace, etc., to use in tailoring. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand for her services, consistently. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Sega hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her child, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons and lace, etc., to use in tailoring

loans.name: Kareng Marisol

texts.es: Doña kareng se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 2 años vive con sus 3 hijos, tiene mucha clientela pues su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, trabaja de lunes a domingo de las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas logra solventar los gastos del hogar Doña kareng solicita un credito que le permita mejorar su negocio y comprar todos los materiales para elaboracion de sus tortillas como maiz, leña, gas, etc y asi obtener mejores ganancias y darle a sus hijos una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Kareng lives with her three children.  She has been selling tortillas for the last two years.  She has many customers, and her business is home-based. She works seven days per week and is able to meet her household expenses with the income that she makes.

She is seeking a loan which will enable her to make improvements to her business and buy all the supplies she needs in order to make her tortillas, such as corn, firewood, gas and other items.  This will allow her to make more income so that she can provide greater financial stability for her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making corn tortillas.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Ms. Zainab is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last 10 years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Ms. Nasreen is 45 years old and a vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for the past six years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of available funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors and more packs of lace, zippers and buttons, which will be a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier income. She is on her third loan, and she is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of lace, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Josefa Darling

texts.es: La sra. Josefa, es casada su esposo trabaja en mecánica, no tienen hijos que dependan de ellos. Ella trabaja como docente de una universidad desde hace varios años, asi ellos se apoyan para cubrir los principales gastos del hogar. Josefa solicita este crédito para realizar obras de mantenimiento a su humilde hogar, para que se mire bonita, pintara paredes además de eso desea poner cerámica en el piso de un cuarto que todavía no termina de acondicionarlo por falta de efectivo.
texts.en: Josefa is married and her husband works as a mechanic.  They don’t have any dependent children.  She has been working as a teacher at a university for several years.  They support one another in this way so they can pay the household expenses.  Josefa is asking for this loan in order to do maintenance on her humble home, so that it will look nice.  She will paint walls and also wants to install a tile floor in a room that she has not completed due to lack of money.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Osman Antonio

texts.es: El sr. Osman García es casado, tiene 2 hijos que dependen de él, a los que mantiene de su trabajo como conductor de camión para el gobierno, labor un poco pesado pero así día a día don Osman sale a recorrer las calles. Solicita este crédito para la construcción de un porche en la parte delantera de su casa además desea poner cerámica en el piso para darle un poco mas de vida a su hogar para que su familia viva de una manera digna, sus hijos puedan jugar con un poco más de espacio.
texts.en: Osman Garcia is married and has two children who depend on him.  He supports them through his job as a government truck driver.  The work is a bit tough, but Oman goes out to cover the streets daily.  He is asking for this loan in order to build a porch in front of his home and also to install a floor so that he can provide his family a better home life in a dignified way.  His children will be able to play in a bit more room.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Dúo Girasoles De Patzun Group

texts.es:
DUO GIRASOLES DE PATZUN
LA SEÑORA  AGUSTINA DE 41 AÑOS DE EDAD VIVE EN CHIMALTENANGO, ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y SE DEDICA A LA ELABORACION DE SUETERES, ES MUY RESPONSABLE  POR ESA RAZON  LAS PERSONAS LA BUSCAN Y LE HACEN PEDIDOS,PERO EN OPORTUNIDADES  NO LOGRA CUBRIR TODOS LOS PEDIDOS  POR EL FACTOR ECONOMICO . POR ESA RAZON ACUDE A FAPE Y KIVA PARA SOLICITAR UN CREDITO Y DE ESA MANERA PODER INVERTIR MAS YA QUE ELLA NO CUENTA CON OTRO TRABAJO Y DEPENDE SOLO DE ESE NEGOCIO Y DEVE CUIDARLO PARA TENER SIEMPRE SU TRABAJO. ESTA SOLICITANDO ESTE CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIA PRIMA PARA LA ELABORACION DE SUETERES PARA LA VENTA.
texts.en: Agustina is 41 years old and lives in Chimaltenango.  She is very hardworking and makes sweaters.  She is very responsible and for this reason is sought after by people who place orders with her, but there are times when she is unable to meet all of her orders due to financial reasons, so she approached FAPE and Kiva to request a loan to be able to invest more.  She doesn’t have any other work and depends solely on this business and she must care for it so that she will always have work.  She is asking for this loan to buy sweater-making supplies.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Luis Wilfredo

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 41 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su esposa y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa de dican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Luis no pudo estudiar la carrera militar que deseaba, pero le hubiera gustado servir a su patria, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Parrillada para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Luis trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas, realiza labores de sembrado y cosecha, Luis se siente bien trabajando y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y buen desempeño.
texts.en:
Luis is 41 years old and lives in the city of Ica, within the Santiago district, along with his wife and two children, whom he loves and are his main reason for living.  He is a friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who, along with his wife, dedicates all of his efforts to getting his family ahead.  Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources, he needed to begin working very young, in order to help out his family.  Luis was not able to study for the military career that he wanted to, but would have liked to have been able to serve his country.  He likes to read a little in his spare time and sometimes prepares a delicious grilled meat to share with his family.

Luis works as a field worker on a farm in town.  He works daily for about 10 hours and plants and harvests.  Luis feels good when he is working and believes that things are going well due to his being responsible and dedicated.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Grethel Isabel

texts.es: La sra. Grethel es casada, ella trabaja como cajera desde hace más de un año con sus ingresos hace el gran esfuerzo para pagar sus estudios de Lic. en Química y Farmacia ya que tiene muchas ganas de superación. Solicita el crédito para poder cancelar el curso de titulación de la Carrera, ya que su salario no le es suficiente y tiene que mantener sus gastos del hogar y con la poca ayuda que recibe de su esposo, juntos logran pagar sus gastos.
texts.en: Grethel is married and has been working as a cashier for more than a year.  She uses her income to pay for her pharmacist studies and she has a great desire to get ahead.  She is asking for this loan in order to pay for a required course, because her salary is not sufficient and she has to pay household expenses.  She gets a little help from her husband and together they manage to pay her expenses.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Ms. Nusrat is 37 years old and the mother of six children. For three years, Nusrat  has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread earner at that point in time. 

With the passage of time, Nusrat’s sales increased and also her income. Now she has seven buffaloes and three cows. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to school for further studies.  

Nusrat has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Ms. Saira is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house. She has gained two years of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Saira is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Zubida

texts.en:
Ms. Zubida is 40 years old and the mother of six children. For 20 years, Zubida has been running a business of caring for animals and selling their milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo, in order to support her family. Prior to that time, her husband had been the only bread earner. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has one buffalo and two cows. This has all happened due to her courage and determination.

She has some savings, and she has applied for a loan of PKR 25,000. She will use the funds to purchase another buffalo. She is in her third loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She expects a boost in her business income, as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Shakila

texts.en:
Ms. Shakila is a 29-year-old, married woman. She has been doing a business of caring for animals, and gathering and selling their milk, for the past 10 years. She has eight buffaloes and two cows in milk. She sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. She has three daughters and two sons. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life, with enough food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life.

This is her third loan from Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business, with the support of loan financing. Recently, she requested a loan of PKR 35,000, which she intends to use to purchase one more cow.  She hopes to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es: Doña maria se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace 4 años vive con su esposo en casa propia su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y teien mucha clientela con las ganacias que obtiene logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar Doña Maria solicita un credito que le permita comprar los materiales para elaborar las pupusas como. maiz, arroz, frijol, quesiilo y poder comparar una nueva plancha para hacer las pupusas como la que muetra en la fotografia y asi obtener mas ganancias y tener una mejor estabilidad economica
texts.en: Maria sells pupusas and has for four years.  She lives with her husband in a home of her own and her business is located in the home.  She has many customers and is able to cover her household expenses with her earnings.  Maria is asking for a loan that will allow her to buy ingredients, such as dried corn, rice, beans, cheese to make pupusas, and also a new griddle like the one in the picture.  In this way she can obtain more income, obtain greater earnings, and have more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Ruth Esmeralda

texts.es: Ruth se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa faldas, pantalones, blusas, etc desde hace 8 años vende de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia y tiene mucha clientela con las ganancias que obtiene logra sacar adelante a su familia vive con su esposo y su hija, ella solicita un credito que le permita comprar mas mercaderia y poder obtener mejores ganancias y asi mejorar su estabilidad economica
texts.en:
Ruth works selling all types of clothing: skirts, pants, blouses, etc. She has been doing this for eight years. As a street vendor, she works in the area where she lives and has many customers. The profit she makes allows her to provide for her family. She lives with her husband and daughter.

She will use the loan she is requesting to purchase more merchandise and obtain higher profits so that she can have more financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (clothing).

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Ms. Salma is a 23-year-old married woman. She has been running a general store business for the last five years with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Salma’s husband.  

In order to make her store fully stocked, Salma contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase a stock of rice and flour, with packs of pulses and grains. 

Salma hopes to get an increase in her net income through her large sales. She wishes to spend part of the income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase stock of rice and flour, with packs of pulses and grains.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Ms. Shamim is 42 years old and a married woman. She has been running a business of caring for animals and selling their milk, with her husband, for many years. They have four buffaloes in milk, and they sell the milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk.  Shamim looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them, while her husband sells the dairy products to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing the work together, to support their family.

She has three daughters and three sons. Two of her children are school-going. The family needs to earn much more, to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing, and education. In order to make huge profits, Shamim requested a loan of PKR 35,000, which she will use to buy one more buffalo. The additional milk will enable them to cater to more customers. She hopes to get an increase in the milk-production capacity of the herd, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo, to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Ms. Shazia is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She established a small store in a corner of her house one year ago. Now she has attained a regular list of customers and makes a good enough income to meet the family's expenses. 

Shazia has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She is in her fourth loan cycle, and currently she requested a loan of 25,000 PKR. Shazia intends to use this loan amount to purchase stock of sugar, rice and grains to meet the demands of her customers time after time. 

Shazia dreams to provide a prosperous future to her children.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice and grains.

loans.name: Niaz

texts.en:
Ms. Niaz is a 52-year-old married woman; she has been doing a business of milk sales for many years. She has two buffaloes and sells their milk to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough for her to lead a decent life. 

Niaz has five children, and three of them are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. Niaz has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. Her husband is a pension holder who also assists her in running this business. The milk selling business is a major source of income for meeting their household expenses. 

It’s Niaz’s second year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through support of it. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of milk, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Irma  Haydee

texts.es: doña irma de 56 años de edad vive con su hijo en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Irma, who is 56 years old, lives with her son in her own home. She has a store where she sells essential goods like beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other products. She has been in business for many years, and this has provided her with the experience in sales that now allows her to obtain the most profit. The store is located in her home and is very well known in her neighborhood. She has reached a large customer base because she keeps her store well stocked.

She wants to expand her business and make a new investment, but she needs capital. That is why she is requesting a loan that will allow her to buy what she needs for her store. She assures us that she will pay off the debt and is also confident that she will provide her family with a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Imtiaz

texts.en: Ms. Imtiaz is 27 years old and a married woman. She has been running a business of animal sales and purchases, for many years. She buys animals (baby goats and baby cows) at low prices and brings them up, and then her husband sells them out in the market, at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Currently, she is requesting a loan of PKR 20,000. She will use it to purchase two more goats. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Ms. Azra is a 45-year-old widow. She started a business selling milk to contribute to the family income. She has three buffaloes that she milks. She sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that is made from the milk. She looks after the buffaloes and collects milk from them. Her son also assists her in selling it to the people of their community. She is a mother of three; one of her children attends school. She dreams to provide a quality education to her other children as well. She is working hard to meet the needs of her family. In order to increase her sales she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo. This will enable her to cater to more customers. Azra hopes to increase her milk production capacity, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Ms. Lubna is a 27-year-old, married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for five years. She makes balls in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing good-quality footballs, and she earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income, because her husband’s income is not alone sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members. 
 
Lubna is a motivated mother of six children. She is responsible for providing them with good quality food, education and clothing. For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of PKR 20,000. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in a large quantity, which will enable her to cater to more customers, without delay. She is hoping to get an increase in her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of her profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in a large quantity, for making more footballs.

loans.name: Anser

texts.en:
Ms. Anser is a 52-year-old, married woman and a mother of four. One of her sons is shown in the photo with her; he is running a shop of dressmaking supplies. He has a great collection of laces and ribbons to offer, and he earns enough to contribute to the family's income.

Anser wants her son's business to grow, so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000. Her son intends to use this loan amount to purchase a greater variety of laces, ribbons, and buttons, in different colors, to increase his sales. Anser is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety of laces, ribbons, and buttons, in different colors.

loans.name: Rita Antonia

texts.es: Rita de 49 años de edad vive junto a sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de uso personal por catalogo, cremas, lociones, cosméticos, entre otros, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas, comercia de forma ambulante por todos los alrededores de la zona, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues las personas la prefieren por la calidad del producto, los buenos precios y el excelente servicio; ella quiere realizar una nueva inversión por eso le solicita un crédito que le permita comprar cremas, lociones, cosméticos, etc. y asi ofrecerle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en: Forty-nine-year-old Rita lives with her three children.  She sells personal products from catalogs for a living, such as creams, lotions, and cosmetics, among others.  She has had her business for several years and it has given her a lot of experience in sales.  She does her selling on foot all throughout the area.  She has built up a lot of clientele, as people prefer her for the quality of her products, her good prices, and her excellent service.  She wants to make a new investment, which is why she is asking for a loan to buy creams, lotions, cosmetics, etc., and thereby offer her family a full life.

loans.use: to buy creams, lotions, and other articles

loans.name: Pierre

texts.en: Thanks to the support of Kiva funders, Pierre is applying for a new loan! After being funded on Kiva, Pierre received a “business in a bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.  He used this “business in a bag” to launch a clean energy entrepreneurship with EarthSpark. He sold out of his products so quickly that he has paid off his loan and is now coming back to us for another loan. With this money, he will continue to sell solar desk lamps as well as kerosene and charcoal-efficient stoves in his community.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Yaovi

texts.fr: Jeune homme de 26ans, Yaovi est électricien de profession. Il revend dans une boutique des appareils sonores, guitares, haut-parleurs et amplis) depuis 2006. Son troisième crédit lui permet de s’approvisionner en marchandises pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins des clients. Il espère agrandir son activité et assurer au mieux à ses besoins.
texts.en: Yaovi is a young, 26-year-old man who works as an electrician. He resells sound equipment, guitars, loudspeakers and amplifiers in a store, and has done so since 2006. This is his third loan, and it will allow him to better meet his customers’ requests. Yaovi hopes to expand his business, and to better provide for himself.

loans.use: To buy sound equipment.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan, age 53, is a cacao farmer from the beautiful village of Santa Cruz. He and his wife Venusciana raised ten children. Each son owns a farm, while his daughters are married. The village is at the southern most part of Toledo along a newly constructed highway leading to the Guatemalan border.

Juan started his cacao farm from a nursery organized by a local association. Juan, together with his children manages two acres of 400 cacao trees, which now, are starting to produce. 

The drying process for cacao has been challenging to Juan. However, he has been energized by the fact that Maya Mountain cacao purchases freshly harvested cacao from the farm to the scale. Juan also cultivates other variety of farm crops.

Due to the financial benefits that his cacao farm brings to his family, Juan is requesting a loan to invest in grafted seedling so as to expand his farm.  His ambition is to improve the quality of life and healthcare for his family.  In addition, he encourages his grand children to gain some level of education and in the future the farm will be owned and managed by his five sons.

loans.use: Expand and transplant grafted seeds for his cacao farm

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia, age 45, and her husband Miguel are organic certified cacao farmers with Maya Mountain Cacao. Together they raised ten children of which five are still living at home. Alicia and her family live in the beautiful village of San Jose, in the southernmost part of Toledo District. 

Alicia and her husband both got inspired to start planting cacao from a local cacao farmer in the said village. Alicia and her daughter manages their 1000 productive trees. Miguel cultivates other farm crops such as rice, beans, pikatoria and so finds limited time to work on the cacao farm. Alicia enjoys cleaning under the mature trees, and harvesting. 

Drying of cacao beans has been a major issue, now with the Maya Mountain Cacao Company buying “wet” or freshly harvested cacao beans this has been a relief for her. Alicia says  “Cacao is money, when I need money for my grocery I go directly to harvesting and wait for Maya Mountain Cacao to sell”.

This loan will help Alicia hire persons to clean and underbrush her cacao trees. Also, Alicia and her daughter can focus a little more on the younger children and assisting them with their schoolwork.

loans.use: To Clean and Transplant her cacao trees

loans.name: Yuri Nikolay

texts.es:
Yuri es un hombre de 42 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su pequeño hijo, a quien ama y es su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su pequeño; gracias a su esfuerzo Yuri pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo gestionar su título profesional y no ejerce su profesión, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta distraerse viendo televisión y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pallares para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Yuri trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y servicio de fotocopias, él trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su responsabilidad y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Yuri se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de los útiles escolares que necesita su pequeño, como libros, cuadernos, plumones, cartulinas y otros, de esta manera él podrá contar con los materiales adecuado para cursar sus estudios, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño ver  a su hijo convertido en un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Yuri is 42 years old.  He lives in the city of Ica in the district of Parcona with his young son, whom he loves and who is his main reason for living.  He is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who does all he can to get his little one ahead.  Through his own effort, Yuri was able to pursue a degree in education.  Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources, he was not able to get his professional license and he does not practice his profession, but he would like to do so.  In his free time he likes to watch TV for fun and sometimes he makes delicious rice with lima beans to share with his family.  

Yuri works at his small business selling groceries and offering photocopying services on his own initiative and with a lot of hard work and dedication.  He works every day for around 10 hours and he thinks it is doing well because he is responsible and he treats others kindly.

Yuri is very thankful to Kiva's lenders, as it is thanks to their help that he will be able to buy the school supplies his little one needs, such as books, notebooks, felt pens, and poster board, among others.  This will allow him to have the materials he needs to complete his studies.  He will keep working and applying himself to achieve his greatest dream of seeing his son become a real professional.

loans.use: to buy school supplies

loans.name: Boezemwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme M.SIDONIE représente le groupe BOEZEMWENDE. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 18ans et le moins âgé a 02ans. 04 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend du savon local de la Côte d’Ivoire (kabakourou)  depuis 02ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Toecin. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 01sac de savon (kabakourou).
Mme veut renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
M. Sidonie is the representative of the Boezemwende group. She is married and mother to five children, the oldest of whom is 18 and the youngest two years of age. Four of her children go to school.

M. Sidonie sells a local soap from the Ivory Coast known as “kabakourou”, and has done so for the past two years. She gets her supplies in Toecin, and her customers are both male and female. With her loan she plans to buy one sack of this kabakourou soap, and with her profits she hopes to consolidate her business. Her plan is to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy one sack of local soap (called “kabakourou”).

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Jorge es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus 3 hijos es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra los principales granos básicos como lo son, maíz y frijol. jorge desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Jorge is a man who is very responsible about his obligations to his household.  He has always been known for providing his children with the best.  He currently lives with his wife and their three children.

He is a very hard-worker.  He has always worked with joy and enthusiasm.  He is a farmer, and he grows basic crops like corn and beans.

Jorge wishes to increase his sales.  Therefore, he visited the Integral offices in order to request a loan.  The loan will allow him to buy seeds, manure, fertilizers, and pesticides, among others.  He wishes to have the requested help because he does not have other income.  This way he will continue bringing home the daily bread without any impediments.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies (manure, corn, and fertilizers, etc.).

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Don Mauricios es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable quien vive junto a dos hijos, Don Mauricio se dedica a la pesca artesanal desde hace varios años, contando con una pequeña lancha y algunas redes para obtener mariscos, la cual le permite salir adelante y cubrir los gastos de su hogar. Él solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de más redes para pescar, también anzuelos y otros instrumentos necesarios para realizar la pesca diariamente, para darles una mejor vida a sus hijos en donde puedan contar con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Mauricio is a very hardworking and responsible man who lives with his two children. Mauricio has made a living as a fisherman for many years. He owns a small boat and some nets for catching seafood. This trade helps him to move forward and pay his household expenses. 

Mauricio is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of more fishing nets, bait, hooks and other necessary equipment for his daily fishing. He hopes this will help him to provide his children with a better life where they won't have to go without.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Joel Nehemias

texts.es: joel se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es un hombre responsable, honesto y trabajador vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos. El esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas para su cosecha y poder darle una mejora a su terreno que muestra en la fotografia ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener un mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Joel has made a living in agriculture for various years. He grows corn and beans, which he sells in order to help him pay his household expenses. He is a responsible, honest, and hardworking man who lives with his wife and their two children. 

Joel is requesting this loan in order to buy some farming supplies such as compost, fertilizer, and seeds. These will help him to improve his land, pictured above, and crops to help him make ends meet. Improving his crops will increase his income and help stabilize his finances.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the cost of their children's education

loans.name: Shawni Marleny

texts.es:
Shawni es una joven de 19 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Shawni se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas, en sus ratos libres le gusta ingresar a internet y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pato para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Shawni trabaja en su pequeño negocio bazar, donde vende diversos productos, como cuadernos, lapiceros, hojas, regalos, moños y ganchos para cabello y otros, ella trabaja ocupando un pequeño espacio en su vivienda, la cual queda enfrente de un pequeño colegio, el mismo que le ha servido de mucho para aumentar sus ventas.
Shawni se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una computadora, la cual le servirá de mucho para poder realizar sus trabajos académicos y prácticas, de esta manera Shawni seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de convertirse en una buena profesional y junto a su familia desea salir adelante.
texts.en:
Shawni is a 19-year-old young single woman living in the city of Ica, in the district of Santiago with her parents and siblings. She is a very friendly, hardworking and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to improve herself. 

Due to her efforts and her parents' help, Shawni is studying Systems Engineering. In her free time she likes to go on the internet and on some occassions cook a delicious dish of rice and duck to share with her family.

By her own initiative, with much persistence and dedication, Shawni works in her small variety store, where she sells an assortment of products such as notebooks, pens, paper, gifts, ribbons, hairpins etc... She works in a small space in her house located in front of a small school, which has helped her increase sales.

Shawni is very thankful to Kiva lenders. Due to the help provided she will be able to purchase a computer, which will help her with her academic work and internship, this way Shawni can continue working and striving to achieve her big dream of becoming a good professional and together with her family she wishes to come out ahead.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: Doña josefa se dedica  a la venta de leña desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiewne mucha clientela especialmente las señoras que venden pupusas y tortillas pues ellas cocinan el maiz con lecha con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante Doña Josefa solicita un credito que le permita poder comprar mas leña para vender y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor vida
texts.en:
Josefa has been selling firewood for many years. She runs her business right out of her home and she has many customers, especially women who sell pupusas (a typical Salvadorean food) and tortillas because they cook their products over firewood. With the money that she earns, Josefa is able to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more firewood to sell, in this way, increase her profits and earn a better life.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Rosario Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Rosario de 46 años se dedica a la elaboracion de gorros, manteles, bufandas, etc de crochet ella tiene su negocio en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años con las ganancias que obtiene ha logrado salir adelante con su familia, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijas en casa propia, Doña Rosario solicita un cerdito para poder comprar mas mercaderia que le ayude con la elaboracion como: lana, agujas, hilos, etc y asi poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Rosario is 46 years old and makes a living making hats, tablecloths, scarves, and other crocheted items. She runs a business out of her home and for several years now she has been able to help her family get ahead with her earnings. Rosario lives with her husband and her two daughters in a house they own.

She is requesting this loan in order to buy more supplies to help her create products such as wool, yarn, etc. so that she can increase her earnings and stabilize her finances.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wool, yarn, needles, etc.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: Jose de 67 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y su hijo se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz y frijol con las ganancias que obtiene logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar. jose desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso a solicitado un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes asi como muestra en la fotografia entre otras cosas, para seguir llevando el pan de cada dia a su hogar.
texts.en: Jose is 67 years old. He is very responsible with his duties at home and has always strived to provide his family with the best. Currently, Jose lives with is wife and their son. Jose makes a living growing corn and beans and with his earnings from selling them he pays his household expenses. Jose hopes to increase his sales so he is requesting this loan to help him buy seeds, compost, fertilizer (as you can see in his photo), and other items that will help him put food on the table each day.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Don manuel se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maiz y frijol, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de granos basicos que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir los gastos, Don manuel esta solicitando un credito para poder comparar insumos agricolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes y para el alquiler de su tierra que muestra en la fotografia y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir solventando los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en:
Manuel has been a farmer for many years and this has given the necessary abilities and knowledge to attend to his crops. His main crop is corn and beans. He sells his products to staple crop companies that are near his home. With the profits he receives through the sales he is able to cover expenses. 

Manuel is requesting a loan to be able to buy agricultural supplies which help him in planting his crops such as manure, seeds, fertilizer as well as the rental fee for the land, which is shown in the photograph. This way he can have better profits and continue settling his household expenses without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to pay for the rental fee of the land.

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es: lorena de 34 años de edad es una mujer muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive con sus 3 hijos es muy trabajadora, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra maíz y frijol cuando esta lista su cosecha la lamacena en sacos como muestra la fotografia y luego sale a comercializarlos cerca de su lugar de residencia. Lorena  desea incrementar sus ventas por eso solicita un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así ella seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Lorena, 34, is a woman who is very responsible with her household obligations, because she has always been known for providing the best for her children.  She now lives with her 3 children.  She is very hardworking, and always does her work cheerfully and with enthusiasm.  She is a farmer who cultivates corn and beans.  When her harvest is ready, she stores it is sacks such as the ones shown in the photograph, which she later goes out to sell in places close to her home.  Lorena wants to expand her sales, and so to do this she is requesting a loan to buy seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, pesticides, and other supplies.  She needs the help of this loan, because she has no other financial resources.  This way, she will be able to continue to bring daily sustenance to her household without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Ms. Shagufta is a 25-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has 1.5 years of experience in this field.  Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

Shagufta is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy stocks of rice and sugar with packs of beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. 

She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice and sugar with packs of beverages.

loans.name: Andrea Estefanía

texts.es:
Andrea de 20 años de edad, es madre cabeza de familia de un bebe de tres meses; debido a que su cónyuge decidió marcharse y no responder por su obligación como padre, Andrea debió buscar alternativas de ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hijo y colaborarle a su madre con la que actualmente vive con los gastos del hogar. 
Desde hace un año aprendió a fabricar calzado, por lo cual decidió iniciar con esta actividad, hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que  invertirá en la compra de materiales y una pulidora manual con el fin de mejorar la calidad de la producción. Su mayor sueño es brindarle a su hija mejores condiciones de vida  y alejada de todo carencia económica.
texts.en:
Andrea, 20, is head of the household and mother of a three month old. Because her spouse decided to leave and not take responsibility for his obligations as a father, Andrea had to look for alternatives for income to support her child. Andrea is living with her mother who is currently paying for the household expenses.

A year ago Andrea learned to make footwear, thus she decided to begin with this activity. Today she is asking for a loan that she will invest in the purchase of materials and a manual polisher with the purpose of improving the quality of the production. Her greater dream is to offer her child better living conditions and to move away from all financial shortfalls.

loans.use: to purchase materials and a manual polisher to make footwear.

loans.name: Beatriz Elena

texts.es:
Beatriz, se dedica desde hace 15 años a la venta de accesorios y alimento para caninos, negocio que logró montar con esfuerzo y muchos sacrificios. 
Agradece a Dios, por la bendición que recibió al tener una fuente de ingresos que le permitiera salir adelante y luchar por el bienestar de su familia. Hoy cuenta con una tienda altamente acreditada y muy conocida en el sector. Su mayor sueño es poder convertirla en la número uno e incrementar sus servicios como peluquería para mascotas. Beatriz sabe que estos sueños solo son posibles con mucha disciplina. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía con el  propósito de ofrecer un servicio de calidad lo que le generará mayores ingresos y un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Beatriz has had a business selling accessories and food for dogs for 15 years. She started up this business with a lot of effort and many sacrifices.  She thanks God for the blessing that she has received, which has allowed her to have a source of income so that she could get ahead and strive for her family's well-being.  

She now has a very reputable shop that is well known in the neighborhood.  Beatriz's main dream is to become the number one shop and to increase her services to include pet grooming services.  Beatriz knows that these dreams can be achieved with a lot of discipline.  At this time, she is requesting a loan to invest in merchandise so that she can offer quality service and thereby generate the best earnings, improving her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing and care products for dogs)

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en:
Ms. Mariyam is a 31-year-old married woman. For the past five years, she has been successfully running a milk shop at her home, where she sells milk to the people of her community. 

Over time, Mariyam has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Mariyam's husband is employed in a textile mill, but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family.
