She has some savings and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Salma is very thankful to Kashf for the support.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Norma Janneth

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 21 años de edad es casada vive con sus familiares en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos 


Nancy se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. 

Solicita el crédito para los insumos que necesita para la agricultura como  abono, insecticida,  fertilizantes, urea, fungicida. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar un terreno. El desafío al que se enfrenta es trabajar mucho más. En su tiempo libre le gusta descansar
texts.en:
Nancy is 21 years old, married and living with her family in Ventanas, in the Los Ríos province.

She makes a living in agriculture, sowing corn.

Nancy is applying for a loan to buy the supplies she needs for her agricultural work.  These supplies are manure, insecticide, fertilisers, urea and fungicides and she will buy them in Ventanas.

Nancy's dream is to buy a plot of land.  The challenge Nancy is facing is to work much more.  In her spare time she likes to relax.

loans.use: to buy manure, insecticide, fertilisers, urea and fungicides.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
le groupe est composé de 3 femmes qui habitent le même village te font toute le commerce.
  Fatou est la représentante du groupe,elle se positionne au milieu de le photo. Âgée de 33 ans ,elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont une fille et 4 garçons.
  Elle travaille avec son marie dans la confection de salon en bambou. Avec son prêt elle achète tout le matériel (bois, éponge,tissu,pointe) et son marie se charge de la main d’œuvre. Elle expose le produit fini sur la route nationale. son activité marche bien car il n'a pas de concurrente dans la zone.
  Avec ses bénéfices elle gère les dépenses de la maison avec son marie,elle prend en charge aussi ses enfants.
texts.en: This group is made up of 3 women who live in the same village and are all retailers. Fatou is the group representative and is standing in the middle of the picture. She is 33 years old, married and the mother of 5 children, one girl and 4 boys. She works with her husband, making bamboo lounge furniture. She uses her loan money to buy the necessary materials (wood, sponge, fabric, etc.) and her husband takes care of the labour. She displays the finished product at the side of the main road. Her business is going well as she has no competition in the area. She uses her profits to take care of the household expenses with her husband, and she also takes care of her children.

loans.use: to buy 175 000 francs' worth of wood, 75 000 francs' worth of fabric, 20 000 francs' worth of sponge and 50 000 francs' worth of other items.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 38-year-old, married mother of two. She has been running a cloth-selling business for many years, purchasing a variety of fabrics from the main city and selling them to the people in her neighbourhood. She has become famous for selling good quality cloth in her community. 

Safia requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy different fabrics for the summer season, by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through increased sales. 

Safia hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric for resale.

loans.name: Rashidan

texts.en:
Rashidan is a 47-year-old married woman. 

She has been successfully running a small general store in her community with her husband for the last two years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to use part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Riyaz

texts.en:
Mrs. Riyaz is a 48-year-old, married woman. She has provided cooking services from her own home for the past seven months. She enjoys making food and has become famous in her city for cooking these specialties. She earns enough to lead a decent life. Her husband assists her in taking orders from customers. 

Mrs. Riyaz is a responsible mother and needs to earn more to afford the daily expenditures of her family members. This is why she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy rice, flour, oil and salt at lower rates from the market. In this way, she will be able to increase her sales. She plans to spend her earned profits on her children’s education and well-being.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, oil and salt at lower rates from the market.

loans.name: Ayesha

texts.en:
At the age of 24, Ayesha is an energetic single woman. 

She has been efficiently doing a business of candle making for many years; it’s been a passion for her. Immense experience in the art of candle making has lent her great versatility in making candles to meet her clients' needs. 

This is her seventh year with Kashf Foundation and for the improvement of her business she requires loan of PKR 50,000 to buy additional material required for making candles such as wax, color dyes, fragrance and molds. It would help her to inflate her sales, which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy an additional material required for making candles such as wax, color dyes, fragrance and molds.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 56-year-old married woman. She is the mother of six children and is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she started a general store business one year ago at the corner of her house. She is contentedly doing it for the sake of her family. 

She has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase packs of biscuits, sweets and spices. She is hopeful to increase her earnings and she dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase packs of biscuits, sweets and spices.

loans.name: Sabrah

texts.en:
Sabrah is a 23-year-old lady. She has been in the beauty parlor business for eight years. She knows the techniques of makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her services she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. But because of having low cash in hand she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. 

She needs a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy hair care products, makeup kits and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She expects a boost in her earning and wishes to spend part of the revenue on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, makeup kits and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a mother of six children and is liable to fulfill their basic needs. 

She decided to work with her husband to support her family for a better future. Two years ago she began to do stitching work in her house. She stitches small bags of cloth that are used on the occasion of weddings and birthday parties. She makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

Due to lack of availability of funds, however, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is currently in her first loan cycle and has borrowed PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy stock of cloth and thread in different colors to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy stock of cloth and thread in different colors.

loans.name: Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très expérimentées dans le programme de l’institution, ces dernières sont très actives  dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu, plus particulièrement le petit commerce. Elles habitent toutes le même quartier favorisant une  bonne entente et solidarité de groupe très appréciées.

Madame Aminata  (assise à droite) est l’emprunteuse vedette  du groupe.   Elle est  mariée et mère de sept garçons et de trois filles et est âgée de 66 ans. Elle joue un rôle très déterminant dans le banc villageois, d’une influence très positive, elle est  très appréciée par les membres du groupement. Elle a une activité très diversifiée axée sur l’habillement, les produits cosmétiques et autres accessoires  femmes. Cette activité, elle la pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Avec ce nouveau prêt elle va renforcer son commerce par l’achat en gros de  cartons de cheveux artificiels communément appelé «mèche » quels que cartons de lait de beauté.

Avec les bénéfices elle compte  réfectionner sa maison.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who have a lot of experience with the institution's program and are very busy with revenue-generating activities, in particular small trade. They all live in the same district, which promotes good relationships and a group solidarity which is much appreciated.

Aminata (sitting on the right) is the featured borrower of the group. She is 66 years old, married and the mother of 7 boys and 3 girls.  She plays a crucial role in the "banc villageois" and provides a very positive influence. She is very highly valued by the group members. She has a diversified business which is centred on clothing, beauty products and other women's accessories. She has been running her business for several years. She plans to use this new loan to strengthen her business by buying some boxes of artificial hair, commonly called extensions, and body lotion wholesale. She plans to use the profits to fix up her home.

loans.use: to buy boxes of hair extensions and beauty lotion wholesale.

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is a 38-year-old married woman. 

She has been in a beauty parlor business for eight years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through her services she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. But because of having low cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. 

She needs a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers time after time, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: José Esteban

texts.es:
José tiene 36 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo. Él aprendió el oficio de peluquero y desde hace seis años, practica ese oficio; antes trabajaba como jornalero en el campo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar un espejo, un sillón y para realizar mejoras a su vivienda. Con la inversión comprara otro espejo y un sillón más para que sus clientes estén más cómodos y puedan ver mejor como les ha quedado el corte de cabello; satisfaciendo a los clientes y brindándoles un mejor servicio. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio y poseer una vivienda propia.
texts.en:
José is 36 years old and is married with one son.  He learned how to be a barber when he was 6 years old and currently works as one.  Before, he worked as a day laborer in the country.

The loan that he is asking for from Fundación Campo is to buy a mirror, a barber's chair, and to make some improvements to his house.  With the loan, he will buy an additional mirror and a barber's chair so his customers are more comfortable and can better see how their haircuts have turned out.  This will satisfy his customers and offer them better service.  His wish is to expand his business and have his own house.

loans.use: buy a mirror, barber's chair, and pay for improvements to his house.

loans.name: Root

texts.en:
Root is 29 years old and married. She stared a beauty parlor at the corner of her house to contribute to the family income. She is happy to be a working hand in support of her husband and start bringing income to the home.  She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Through her services, she has becomes very famous in her neighborhood. 

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the parlor so she is requesting a loan for 35,000 PKR, which she will use to buy a hair dryer, hair straightener, and packs of creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She hopes to expand her client base which helps to generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer, hair straightener,  and packs of creams for bleaching and whitening.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila has four children and she dreams of providing good education to them.

She has expertise in hand embroidery and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over 10 years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today she is proud to be famous in her community as the best at making beautiful patterns with beads. 

Now she has requested a loan worth PKR 35,000 to purchase more spools of thread and packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material in various colors. She says that the women in her community are becoming demanding with the passage of time and satisfying them is a challenge that Rahila has taken up.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads and packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material in various colors.

loans.name: Ishrat

texts.en:
Ishrat is a 23-year-old lady who enjoys doing the work of hand embroidery. She is a mother of two children, one daughter and one son. She is working hard to provide them with the basic necessities of life. 

With the passage of time she has attained a regular list of customers and earns enough to contribute to the family income. 

To help her to continue her operations, she requested a loan of PKR 10,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase her income by targeting more customers. 

Ishrat dreams of her children's bright future and desires to provide them quality education. She is very much thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for  embellishment.

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is a 37-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. Her husband is doing labor work and his income is not enough to bear everyday expenses with the educational needs of their children. So she decided to initiate her business of a general store. 

She spared a room in her house and started selling daily products to the people of her community. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently she has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase packs of biscuits, sweets and grains. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase packs of biscuits, sweets and grains.

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en:
Ramzana is a 36-year-old married woman living with four children and her husband. Two of her children are shown in the photo.  

She has been doing a business of shoes making with the support of her husband for many years. With the passage of time she has attained a regular list of customers and earns enough to contribute to the family income. 

This is her third year with Kashf Foundation. With its support, she is fulfilling her dreams and able to manage her children’s education. Now, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy additional material for shoes including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles etc. In this way she can handle the growing demand for her shoes in the market and hence can better support her family. 

She wants a bright future for her children and for this purpose she is trying hard and shows a good example for those women who also want to do their own business.

loans.use: to buy additional material for shoes including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles, etc.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Ms. Shahnaz is 49 years old and a married woman and mother of four. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring in her community. Sh has been doing this for the past many years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. 

Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. To help her continue operations of her business, she requested a loan of Rs.30,000 to buy a stock of thread in different colors with packs of zippers, buttons and lace to meet the increasing demand. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread in different colors with packs of zippers, buttons and lace to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: Fatou Diop's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très expérimentées dans le programme de l’institution, ces dernières sont très actives  dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu, plus particulièrement le petit commerce. Elles habitent toutes le même quartier favorisant une  bonne entente et solidarité de groupe très appréciées.

Madame Diop  (debout à l’extrême droite avec la main gauche levée)  est l’emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est mère de 03 enfants dont 02 filles, elle  est âgée de 31 ans. Très rigoureuse et volontaire à la tâche elle  vend des produits de beauté à  savoir lait corporel et parfum de corps  qu’elle achète auprès de fournisseurs  pour la revente en détail au comptant ou à crédit.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte renouveler son stock  par l’achat de douzaines de lait corporel et de parfum de corps et de chambre.

Les bénéfices tirés de ses activités lui permettront d’assister ses enfants à bas âge dans leur scolarité.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who have a lot of experience with the institution's program and are very busy with their revenue-generating activities, in particular small trade. They all live in the same district, which promotes good relationships and a group solidarity which is much appreciated.

Diop (standing on the right in the picture, with her left hand raised) is the group's featured borrower. She is 31 years old and the mother of 3 children, 2 of whom are girls. A meticulous woman who likes to work, she sells beauty products, namely body milk and body fragrances, which she buys from suppliers and then resells to retail customers for cash or credit. She plans to use this new loan to renew her inventory by buying a few dozen bottles of body lotion, body perfume and room fragrances. The profits generated by her business will enable her to help provide her young children with an education.

loans.use: to buy body lotion, body and room fragrances.

loans.name: Munawar

texts.en:
Mrs. Munawar is 41 years old and married. She has three children -- one daughter and two sons. She is striving hard to meet her family's demands, including food, clothing and health care. Her husband is employed by a railway but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. 

Mrs. Munawar started her tailoring business to contribute to the family's income. She is very familiar with stitching techniques. She initiated her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. 

Currently, Mrs. Munawar has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy stock of threads in different colors and packs of buttons, needles and zippers. This will enable her to be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail.

loans.use: to buy stock of threads in different colors and packs of buttons, needles and zippers for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Ms. Shahnaz is 49 years old and a married woman and mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Shahnaz’s husband who is a driver by trade and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Shahnaz applied for a loan of Rs 30,000 for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shahnaz is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for  her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Ms. Nusrat is 38 years old and a mother of four children. For the past four years, Nusrat has been running a milk sales business. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family; her husband was the only bread-earner at that point in time. With the passage of time her sales increased and also her income. Now she has two buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. 

Because of her work, Nusrat is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings and applied for a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  She is in her 3rd loan cycle with Kashf Foundation and is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Mrs. Noor is a 49-year-old, married lady who has a milk-selling business. Her husband also helps her with her business. She has four milk cows and sells their milk to the people in her community. She has five children -- two daughters and three sons. She is trying hard to fulfill her children’s needs such as health care, clothes and food. 

Mrs. Noor is highly motivated and she is a very hardworking lady. She has set a goal to provide all the necessities of life to her children and put them on track for a better life. She has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy another cow to increase sales of milk. This will improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy another cow to increase sales of milk.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Ms. Yasmeen is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house in her community for the past eight years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is a mother of four children. She is motivated to provide for her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 15,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) to buy packs of biscuits, sugar and grains from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy packs of biscuits, sugar and grains from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Victoriana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña victoriana, es cliente Kiva, de 55 años de edad, originaria de San Juan de Limay, Municipio de Estelí, ella se siente muy agradecida por su primer créditos, ya  que le ayudo a surtir mas su pulpería comprando productos que aun no tenían en inventario como granos básicos, aceite, productos de limpieza, jugo, gaseosa, etc. Ella se siente muy bien porque ha podido incrementar sus ingresos.
Ella esta solicitando su segundo créditos para comprar  artículos escolares, cuadernos, lapiceros, cosméticos, granos básicos, arroz, azúcar, con el objetivo de incrementar más sus ventas para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Victoriana, one of Kiva's clients, is 55 and comes from San Juan de Limay in the municipality of Estelí.  She is very grateful for her first loan which helped her to increase her grocery shop's stock by buying products such as basic grains, oil, cleaning products, fruit juice and soft drinks which she did not previously have in stock .  She feels great because she has been able to increase her income.  She is applying for this second loan to buy school equipment, exercise books, pencils, make-up, basic grains, rice and sugar as her ambition is to further increase her sales and boost her income.

loans.use: to buy school equipment, exercises books, pencils, make-up, basic grains, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Mberry's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est composé de  femmes très expérimentées dans le programme de l’institution, ces dernières sont très actives  dans leurs activités génératrices de revenu, plus particulièrement le petit commerce. Elles habitent toutes le même quartier favorisant une  bonne entente et solidarité de groupe très appréciées.

Madame Mberry (debout, en médaillon à l’extrême droite),  est l’emprunteur vedette du groupe. Elle est un  leader très respecté dans le banc villageois, malgré son âge avancé elle est vendeuse de jus et crème glacée à base de pain de singe et de bissap dans le quartier depuis plus d’une vingtaine années. Elle est veuve, elle prend en charge deux de ses nièces.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter quatre sacs de pin de singe à 4 000 FCFA l’unité, un sac de bissap à 5 000 FCFA, un sac de sucre à 20 000 FCFA et autres produits alimentaires entrant dans la préparation des jus et crème glacée.

Avec les bénéfices réalisés, elle compte assurer la dépense quotidienne et les frais de gestion de la famille.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who have a lot of experience with the institution's program and are very busy with their revenue-generating activities, in particular small trade. They all live in the same district, which promotes good relationships and a group solidarity which is much appreciated.

Mberry (highlighted in an inset, on the far right of the picture) is the group's featured borrower. She is a very respected leader of the "banc villageois" and, despite her advanced years, sells juice and monkey bread- and hibiscus-based ice cream in her district, which she has been doing for over 20 years. She is a widow and takes care of her 2 nieces. Her new loan will enable her to buy 4 bags of monkey bread (4 000 francs each), a bag of hibiscus flowers (5 000 francs), a bag of sugar (20 000 francs) and other ingredients needed to make juice and ice cream. She plans to use the profits generated by her business to cover the daily expenditures and her family's maintenance costs.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of monkey bread, one bag of hibiscus flowers, one bag of sugar and other ingredients needed to make juice and ice cream.

loans.name: Rahul

texts.en:
Ms. Rahul is a passionate woman and has been successfully running a beauty parlor for the last three years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hairstyling and facials. Through her best services, she has become very famous in her street. 

In order to facilitate more customers without delay, she is interested in buying more varieties of cosmetics products for the parlor. But because of having low cash in hand she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. She needs a loan of 15,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) to buy hair straightener and a hair dryer along with packs of bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She hopes to get a boost in her net income and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy hair straightener and a hair dryer along with packs of bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Scarleth De Los Angeles

texts.es: Scarleth, una joven de 30 años de edad soltera sin hijos, quien está intentando progresar con las ventas variadas de zapatos ropa, utensilios  de cocina, trabajo que aprendió de su padre quien hacía lo mismo, ella sale todos los días a las calles a buscar como vender sus productos para con las ventas cubrir sus gastos diarios y ayudar a su familia, este crédito que solicita es para invertir en productos los cuales tiene muy poco, espera que en un futuro pueda establecer sus ventas en un solo punto y así laborar mejor.
texts.en: Scarleth is a young woman of 30 who is single and has no children.  She is trying to make progress in her business selling ranges of shoes, clothing and kitchen utensils, a job she learned from her father who worked in the same business.  She goes out each day looking for opportunities to sell her goods so she can use the proceeds to cover her daily expenses and support her family.  The loan which she is applying for will be used to invest in products which she currently has only in very small quantities.  She hopes that in the future she will be able to have one single point of sale, which will enable her to work more efficiently.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Ms. Shamim is a 43-year-old married woman. She has been providing bookbinding services in her community for the past many years. She takes orders from the nearby schools and the people of her community. In this way, she earns a reasonable amount of income to fulfill the basic needs of her four children. 

To cope with the orders without fail, she applied a loan of 30,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) to purchase cutters, tape and plastic covers in large quantities. She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend the part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase cutters, tape and plastic covers in large quantity.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Ms. Tahira is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last ten years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and counts on a good client list. Her husband is employed in a small factory and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of 35,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) to buy stock of rice and flour along with packs of beverages from the market at lower rates. She then would be able to meet with the increasing demand consistently. She is in her eighth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stock of rice and flour along with packs of beverages from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Chiman

texts.en:
Ms. Chiman is a 55-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of making bags for the past seven years. She makes bags in different sizes and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her city for providing good quality bags and earns enough to bear the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income as she is a motivated mother of four children. She is liable for providing them with good quality food, education and clothing. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of 35,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees). The amount will be used to purchase stock of leather materials in a large quantity along with some spools of threads in various colors. She is hopeful to get an increase in her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of the profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase stock of leather materials in a large quantity along with some spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 62 años,esta casada y tiene un hijo que ya es independiente, ella tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de su esposo.El trabajo de Olga consiste en la venta de pescado. Tiene su puesto de venta en el puerto de pescadores de la ciudad. Se levanta muy temprano para comprar al por mayor sus productos a los pescadores que llegan con todo lo recolectado en su jornada de pesca. Selecciona aquellas especies que tienen mayor demanda entre sus clientes como “palometa”, “bagre”, “sardina”, además se abastece de aquellos que no son tan solicitados pero que tienen muy buen precio en el mercado como “doncella” y “paiche” respetando siempre las etapas de veda. Compra por canastas al por mayor y los vende por kilos, lleva realizando este trabajo cerca de 42 años aproximadamente y menciona que con esta actividad pudo proveer de alimentación y educación a su hijo, ahora ella trabaja sola y lo sigue haciendo por que es el único medio de generar ingresos para su hogar.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo por las tardes para poder estar en su casa y descansar ya que considera que trabajar a su edad ya no es igual que cuando era joven, además siempre fue independiente y se acostumbró a valerse por si misma. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 1500, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Con el monto solicitado comprará pescados de gran demanda entre sus clientes en mayor cantidad ya que en esta temporada el consumo de ciertas especies se incrementa.
texts.en:
Olga is 62 years old, is married, and has a son who is now grown.  She has her own house where she lives with her husband.  Olga's work consists of selling fish.  She has a shop by the fishing docks in the city.  She gets up very early to buy fish wholesale from the fishermen as they arrive with all the fish they've gotten.  She selects the types of fish that are of highest demand among her customers, including harvestfish, catfish, and sardines.  In addition, she stocks up on fish that aren't in such high demand but are available for good prices, including doncella and paiche.  She always respects regulations regarding the season during which each fish can be fished.  She buys her fish wholesale by the basket and sells it by the kilogram.

She has been doing this work for almost 42 years, approximately, and says that with this job she was able to feed and educate her son.  She currently works alone and continues doing it because it is the only way of generating income for her home.  What she likes about her job is that she has time in the afternoon to be able to be at home and rest, since she believes that working at her age isn't the same as when she was young.  In addition, she has always been independent and has become used to getting by on her own.

At this time, she is asking for a loan of 1500 sols (US$600).  She is very grateful for this loan opportunity that is being offered to her and for this financial support that she needs to keep going.  With the loan, she will buy more fish that are in high demand by her customers, since during this time of year the consumption of certain species goes up.

loans.use: buy fish wholesale.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Mrs. Khalida is a 37-year-old, married woman. She enjoys doing hand embroidery. She started doing this work with her daughters. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her territory and there is an increased demand for her embroidery designs. She has six daughters and one son. Her husband is not in good enough physical shape to support their family. 

Mrs. Khalida is motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life, including food, clothes and education. In order to meet the growing demand for her embroidery, she needs to hire some more women. Now she is requesting a loan of PKR 30,000 from the Kashf Foundation. In this way, she will be able to buy more frames, needles and threads in different colors. This will enable her to generate more income. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy more frames, needles and threads in different colors.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Mrs. Kosar is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. Kosar has been running a milk sales business for many years. She also raises cattle to earn extra money. Currently she has two milk buffaloes. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. She has some savings.

Mrs. Kosar has applied for a loan of PKR 10,000 to purchase another buffalo. In this way, she will be able to generate more income through her increased sales. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She wishes to spend part of the profits on providing a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Sulan

texts.en:
Ms. Sulan is a 51-year-old married woman who has been running a business of milk selling with her husband since many years ago; this was their forefathers' business and now they are doing it themselves. The man shown in the photo is Sulan’s husband. They have two buffaloes to milk and sell their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk. She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to support their family. They have five children; three of them are school-going. 

They need to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, Sulan requested a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers. She hopes to get an increase in the production capacity of the milk, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 52 años de edad, es divorciada, vive con su hija en su casa propia ,la cual compró hace muchos años con el apoyo de su ex esposo.El trabajo de Nelly consiste en la venta de comidas como guisos y platillos regionales, atiende por las mañanas preparando desayunos y al medio día vende almuerzos, su local está ubicado en su propia casa el cual lo abrió ya hace 10 años, tiempo que le valió para hacerse conocida en la zona.Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite tener un ingreso económico que le da la tranquilidad que necesita para brindarle lo mejor a su familia.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000 para la compra de arroz por sacos ya que es el principal producto que usa en su trabajo, así mismo usará progresivamente el dinero en la compra de condimentos, tubérculos, verduras y carnes . Además agradece el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su trabajo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Nelly is 52 years old, is divorced, and lives with her daughter in her own house which she bought many years ago with the help of her ex-husband.  Nelly's work involves selling meals such as stews and local dishes.  In the mornings she makes breakfasts and in the middle of the day she sells lunches.  Her shop, which she opened 10 years ago, is located in her house.  During this time she has become well known in her community.

What she likes about her job is that it allows her to have income, which gives her the peace of knowing that she can give the best she has to offer to her family.

At this time, she is asking for a loan of 1,000 sols (US$400) to buy bags of rice, since it is the main product that she uses in her work.  Likewise, she will over time use the money to buy condiments/sauces, tubers, vegetables, and meat.  She is thankful for the financial support that she will receive that will allow her to continue with her work and promises to make her payments in a timely manner.

loans.use: buy ingredients such as rice, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Gladys  Yolanda

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 48 años   de edad  es casada tiene 8 hijos vive con su esposo y sus hijos en el Cantón Chimbo    Provincia Bolívar. 

Gladys  se dedica a la  agricultura como a la siembra  de maíz. Solicita el crédito para  compra de fertilizantes, abonos, insumos y demás elementos para realizar la siembra. Las compras lo realizan en la ciudad de Chimbo.  

Su sueño es mejorar el cultivo para tener una fuente de ingreso para la familia.  El desafío que enfrenta es  de educar a todos los hijos.  En su tiempo libre le gusta salir a caminar   y a pasear con los hijos.
texts.en: Gladys, who is 48, is married with 8 children and lives with them and her husband in Chimbo Canton in Bolívar Province.  Gladys works in agriculture, undertaking tasks such as sowing corn.  She is applying for the loan to buy fertiliser, manure, supplies and other items required for sowing.  She will buy the goods in Chimbo City.  Her dream is to boost her crop yield so as to have a source of income for her family.  Her main preoccupation is providing an education for her children.  In her free time, she likes going out for walks and going for a stroll with her children.

loans.use: to buy fertiliser, manure, supplies and other items required for sowing.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Doña ana vive con su esposo en casa propia, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años con las ventas que realiza de sus granos basicos y con la ayuda de su esposo logran cubrir los gastos de su hogar ella solicita un credito que le permita comprar abonos, pesticidas, herbisidas y foliares asi como muestra la fotografia  y pder seguir con sus cosechas para poder obtener mejores ganancias y tener una mejor vida con su esposo
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband in her own house.  She has made a living in agriculture for several years.  They manage to cover the household expenses with the sales of her basic grains and her husband's help.

She's requesting a loan to buy soil amendments, pesticide, herbicide, and foliar fertilizer, as the photograph shows.  She'll be able to continue with her crops, get better profits, and have a better life with her husband.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es:
Mauricio tiene 35 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Cuenta con 20 años de desempeñar el cultivo de yuca y maíz. Trabajo que aprendió con sus padres, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar por el grado de pobreza de su familia. Él realiza sus propios cultivos, ya que posee una yunta de bueyes con los que ara la tierra para prepararla y también presta esos servicios a sus vecinos. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas, debe viajar durante veinticinco minutos a la ciudad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 20 sacos de fertilizantes, entre otros insumos para el cultivo de yuca y maíz. De esta manera, comprara todos los insumos de una sola vez, para aplicarlos en el momento adecuado para que su cosecha sea muy productiva y pueda venderla a buen precio para ahorrar y comprar un terreno para construir su casa, debido a que en donde vive es de otra persona.
texts.en:
Mauricio, 35, is married and has three children.  He has 20 years of experience growing yucca and corn, work he learned from his parents.  He didn't have the opportunity to go to school because of his parents' poverty.

He takes care of his own crops because he has team of oxen to plow the land to prepare it.  He also offers those services to his neighbors.  He has to travel 35 minutes to the city to buy his supplies.

The loan he's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy 20 sacks of fertilizer and other supplies to grow yucca and corn.

He'll buy the supplies all at once and apply them at the most appropriate time so his harvest will be productive.  This way he can sell it at a good price and save money for a plot of land to build his house, because where he lives now belongs to someone else.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other supplies to grow yucca and corn

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Duran. El vendía lotería pero le robaron y decio cambiar de comercio; ahora vende artículos para el hogar y ropa, el trabaja solo y visita a sus clientes casa por casa.

El trabajo de él es caminar todos los dias y concegir clientes casa por casa para que le compren la ropa o los articulos que vende. Su dificultad son los ladrones ya que tiene miedo que le vuelvan a robar y su enfermedad ya que es pvvs (persona viviendo con vih sida).  No es casado, pero tiene 2 niñas una tiene 11 años y la otra tiene 9 años las dos están en escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo va a comprar artículos para el hogar y ropa para poder seguir vendiendo. Su sueño es terminar de hacer su casa para que sus hijas tengan una vida tranquila.
texts.en:
The client lives in Duran.  He sold lottery tickets, but he was robbed.  He decided to change businesses.  He now sells household goods and clothes.  He works alone, and he visits his customers by going door to door.

His work is walking every day.  He gets customers by going door to door so that they buy the clothes or goods that he sells.  The difficulty is the thieves because he is afraid they will rob him.  His difficulty is also his illness because he is a PVVS (person living with HIV/AIDS).

He is not married, but he has two daughters, ages 11 and 9.  They both go to public school.

He will use the loan to buy household goods and clothes in order to continue selling.

His dream is to finish his house in order for his daughters to have a peaceful life.

loans.use: to buy household goods and men's and women's clothes.

loans.name: Nahid

texts.en:
Nahid is 40 years old and is married. She is a mother of five and is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and health. 

She started her business of sewing clothes to contribute to the family income. She is well familiar with the stitching techniques and earns a reasonable amount of income to lead a decent life. 

In order to complete the orders of her customers on time, she requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to purchase more spools of thread, along with packs of zippers, laces, and buttons in various colors. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to get an increase in her net income and, hence, can better support her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread, along with packs of zippers, laces, and buttons in various colors.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is a 55-year-old, married woman and a mother of three children. 

For the past ten years, Haleema has been running a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying a cow to support her family when her husband was the only bread-earner at that point in time. 

With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has one buffalo and one cow. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

Haleema has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase another cow. She has been in association with Kashf Foundation for three years and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf Foundation for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another cow.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor, de 39 años de edad esta casada y tiene un hijo de 8 años, ella vive en casa de su cuñado a lado de su familia y la familia de su cuñado.El trabajo de Flor consiste en brindar servicio de transporte mediante el alquiler de su vehículo de carha pesada. Desde hace 2 años que se dedica a este trabajo y no ha parado de recibir contratos a diario ya que en la zona en la que vive siempre necesitan de un vehículo de transporte de carga pesada para desembarcar y trasladarse de un lugar a otro con los diversos productos que llegan al puerto de la ciudad como plátanos, sacos de granos, frutas, animales y otros.  Por fortuna le va muy bien en esta actividad y sigue adelante sin desmayar.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/ 2000, está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará combustible y refaccionará su vehículo con la compra de llantas y algunos accesorios.
texts.en: Flor, who is 38, is married with an eight-year-old son.  She lives in her brother-in-law's house along with her family and her brother-in-law's family.  Flor's work involves providing a transport service using her hired heavy-duty vehicle.  She has done this for 2 years and never a day goes by when she does not have business, as in the area where she lives people always need a heavy-duty vehicle to unload and move the different goods (bananas, sacks of grains, fruit, animals etc.) which arrive in the city's port.  Fortunately, Flor is very successful in her business and presses on without losing heart.  This time, she is seeking a loan of S/ 2000 and is very happy with the financial support which she is receiving.   It gives her the confidence to continue her work and, furthermore, she is committed to making her repayments promptly.  She will use the sum requested to buy petrol and will buy tyres and some spare parts to repair her vehicle.

loans.use: to buy tyres and repair her motorbike.

loans.name: Anne Marguerite

texts.fr: Anne est  une jeune femme de 38 ans célibataire mère de 3 enfants. Après sa formation, elle a ouvert un petit atelier de couture qui fonctionne bien depuis 10 ans déjà, elle fait aussi la broderie mais n'a pas tout le matériel pour aller plus vite avec ses commandes et pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle à temps. C'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour s'acheter des tissus et le petit matériel de coutures (épingles, aiguilles, doublure, fil...) qui l'évitera d'aller au marché tout le temps, elle pourra coudre et revendre à ses clients. Le bénéfice tiré de ce crédit lui permettra non seulement de s'acheter son petit matériel de couture pour agrandir son activité, mais aussi de satisfaire certains de ses besoins ainsi que ceux de sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Anne, age 38, is unmarried and the mother of three children. After her training period, she opened a small sewing workshop, which has been doing good business for ten years. She also does embroidery but lacks tools to complete her orders faster and meet customer demand in a timely fashion.

This is why she's seeking a loan to buy fabrics and notions (pins, needles, lining, thread, …) so that she can avoid going to the market all the time, and focus on sewing and selling to her customers.

The profits earned thanks to this loan will enable her to not only buy sewing supplies and expand her business, but also provide for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and notions (pins, needles, lining, thread, …)

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es: “LOS GIRASOLES” un grupo puntual en sus cuotas ellos se encuentran pasando el ciclo 26. Flor es una de las socias tiene 23 años es conviviente con 2 hijos. Hace años tiene si distribuidora de cerveza que puso en su casa. Ella cuenta que le va bien que sus ingresos económicos han mejorado. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de cerveza. Su mayor deseo es darles una profesión a sus hijos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo. Flor es la primera del lado izquierdo viste polo celeste.
texts.en: "LOS GiRASOLES", a group which is always prompt to make its repayments, is now in its 26th loan cycle.  One of its members is 23-year-old Flor who lives with her partner and has 2 children.  For a number of years she has had a beer vending machine in her home.  Things are going well, she says, because her income has improved.  She will use the loan to buy beer.  Her greatest ambition is to provide work for her children.  The group is grateful to KIVA investors for the loan.  Flor is first on the left and is wearing a sky blue top.

loans.use: to buy beer

loans.name: Jose Abrahan

texts.es:
José es un joven de 19 años, emprendedor y con muchas metas para cumplir, pues en el futuro, él sueña con tener su propia finca con varios cultivos cuidados profesionalmente para distribuir a grandes compradores. José es soltero, terminó la secundaria y vive con sus padres José y Elvira en Los Bancos un cantón de la Provincia de Pichincha, una de las provincias  más grandes en la República del Ecuador. Este cantón se encuentra a pocos kilómetros de la ciudad de Quito, y tiene diversidad de bosques, además sus barrios están poblados con gente amable y costumbres propias de esta ciudad en donde también se encuentran establecidas varias microempresas administradas por los emprendedores que luchan por hacer realidad sus sueños cada día. Otras de las actividades sobresalientes son la agricultura y la ganadería, produciendo abundantes cultivos que luego son comercializados para distribuirse hacia muchas provincias. También posee varios atractivos turísticos como cascadas, ríos, senderos, balnearios en donde el turista es atraído por los deportes de aventura que se venden allí con seguridad garantizada. 
José se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche desde hace 2 años, actividad que heredó de sus padres que desde niño le enseñaron las labores de aseo, cuidado, alimentación y ordeño de las vacas. Ahora es una actividad que la realiza a tiempo completo; nueve horas cada día a las cuales pone mucho esfuerzo y dedicación para entregar a sus clientes un producto saludable. Este joven emprendedor está solicitando un préstamo que lo utilizará a comprar un par de vacas jóvenes para producir más litros de leche diarios y así poder incrementar sus ventas de leche, lo cual le generará una mejor utilidad con la cual podrá ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar y además poder seguir preparándose para cuando tenga su finca poder administrarla profesionalmente. José motiva a todas las personas que a través de Kiva pueden conocer su historia, aporten con un granito de arena para que su proyecto sea una realidad y agradece a Fundación Alternativa quienes en la búsqueda de la misión de terminar con la pobreza en el Ecuador, brindan tanto apoyo a los emprendedores y microempresarios del sector rural, con capacitación, asesoría personalizada y ese vínculo familiar que lleva a atender al cliente no solo con servicios financieros sino también servicios no financieros que velen por el bienestar del cliente y su familia.
texts.en:
José is a young man, 19 years old, who is very enterprising and has many goals that he wants to accomplish.  In the future, he dreams of having his own farm with several professionally-cared-for crops to distribute to large buyers.  José is single.  He finished high school and he lives with his parents José and Elvira in Los Bancos, a canton in the province of Pichincha, one of the largest provinces in the Republic of Ecuador.  This canton is located a few kilometers from the city of Quito and has a diversity of forests.  In addition, its neighborhoods are populated with friendly people and typical customs of the city where there are also several small businesses established, run by the entrepreneurs who fight each day to make their dreams a reality.  Other outstanding activities are agriculture and livestock farming, producing abundant crops that are then sold to distribute around to many provinces.  It also has several tourist attractions like waterfalls, rivers, trails and spas where the tourist is attracted by the adventure sports that are sold there with guaranteed security.

José has worked raising cattle for milk production for 2 years, an activity that he inherited from his parents who, since he was a child, taught him the labors of cleanliness, care, feeding and milking of the cows.  Now it is an activity that he carries out full time, nine hours each day to which he puts a lot of effort and dedication in order to deliver a healthy product to his customers.  This young entrepreneur is requesting a loan that he will use to buy a pair of young cows to produce more liters of milk a day and thus he will be able to increase his milk sales, which will generate for him a better profit with which he will be able to help his parents with the household expenses and also be able to continue preparing for when he has his own farm to be able to run it professionally.  José encourages everyone that can hear about his story through Kiva to contribute with a small grain of sand so that his project can be a reality.  He is grateful to Fundación Alternativa who, in the pursuit of the mission to end poverty in Ecuador, provides so much support to the entrepreneurs and small-businesspeople of the rural areas, with training, personalized counseling and that familial bond that leads to attending to a customer not only with financial services but also non-financial services that ensure the well-being of the customer and their family.

loans.use: to buy young cows that produce more milk.

loans.name: Marie Paule

texts.fr: Marie Paule est une femme de 56 ans mariée mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 11 et 32 ans. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail (huile, poisson fumé, pistache) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 8 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter le stock d'huile, de poissons fumés pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Marie Paule is a 56-year-old woman who is married and the mother of 3 children aged between 11 and 32. She is a merchant and has been selling seasonal products (oil, smoked fish, pistachios) to retail customers at a local market for 8 years. She knows the suppliers well and knows her customer base, built up over time thanks to her experience in her line of work, especially well. However, she faces constant stock shortages because, due to her limited capital, she is forced to sell off her stock before she is able to replenish it. She would like to increase her inventory of oil and smoked fish so that she has a well-stocked inventory which would enable her to better satisfy the constant demand of her clientèle and to avoid stock shortages. She will save up her profits so that she can not only expand her business, but also provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of oil and smoked fish.

loans.name: Floberte

texts.fr: Floberte est une femme de 33 fiancée et mère de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 1 et 15 ans. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail (arachides, maïs,couscous) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 10 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera s'approvisionner en sacs d'arachides, maïs et couscous et pierre à écraser pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Floberte, age 33, is engaged and the mother of four children, whose ages range between 1 and 15. For ten years, she's been a retailer in a one of her town's markets. She sells peanuts, corn, couscous, depending on the season.

She knows suppliers well. Thanks to her experience, she acquired over time a clientele that she also knows well. Nevertheless, she often finds herself out of stock. Due to her limited working capital, she needs to sell everything before being able to resupply.

She would like to buy a stone mortar, sacks of peanuts, corn, and couscous, in order to have a good stock. This will enable her to better satisfy her customers and avoid getting out of stock.

She will put away her profits to expand her business, and also provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy a stone mortar, peanuts, corn, and couscous

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Afin de prendre soin des enfants et construire une seconde boutique dans la zone portuaire, Kossi sollicite un second crédit à WAGES. Ce prêt lui servira d’acheter des pneus (activité qu’il exerce depuis 2003) afin de mieux satisfaire les clients. Le profit tiré de cette vente lui servira d’atteindre son objectif. Il est à préciser qu’il est marié et père de 02 enfants(07 et 04ans)tous scolarisé. Il est quant à lui âgé de 33ans.
texts.en: Kossi is requesting a second loan from WAGES so that he can take care of his children and build a second shop in the port area. This loan will be used to buy tyres (he has been selling them since 2003) so that he can better satisfy his customers. The profits generated by the sales will enable him to achieve his goal. He is married and the father of 2 children, aged 7 and 4, who both go to school. He is 33 years old.

loans.use: to buy tyres.

loans.name: Amélégan

texts.fr: Amélégan est âgée de 46ans. Elle a pour conjoint un délégué médical et mère d’un enfant. Elle est revend depuis 1998 des produits d'alimentation générale  dans une boutique et s’approvisionne généralement au grand marché de Lomé. Son premier crédit lui servira à acheter des produits d’alimentation générale (riz, huile végétale, tomates…..) pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins des clients. Elle espère devenir grossiste et fonder une famille financièrement stable.
texts.en:
Amélégan, age 46, is married to a medical representative and the mother of one child. Since 1998, she's been reselling food staples. She usually gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé.

This first loan will be used to buy food staples (rice, vegetable oil, tomatoes, …) in order to meet customers' needs. She hopes to become a wholesaler and ensure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy food staples (rice, vegetable oil, tomatoes, …)

loans.name: Rohbina

texts.en: Ms. Rohbina is a 34-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store at the corner of her house in her community for the last ten years. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communications skills and a good client list. Her husband drives a rickshaw and does not earn enough to support his family by himself. She is the mother of five children and is motivated to provide for her family. As she wants to grow her business, she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy stocks of rice and flour and packs of beverages from the market at low rates. She then would be able to meet increasing demand consistently. She is in her fifth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to use part of her revenues to deal with personal expenses and part to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice and flour, and packs of beverages, from the market at lower rates and sell them in her store.

loans.name: Eva Del Carmen

texts.es:
Eva, 53 años de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortilla Y comida. Su primer préstamo Kiva fue de mucha  ayuda pues llego cuando mas lo necesitaba le permitió invertir mas  en negocio, y mejorar poco a poco su humilde vivienda y la impulso a diversificar mas su negocio. 
Esta necesitando financiamiento para comprar arroz, azúcar, maíz, leña, pues su deseo es vender todas sus comida  y luchar cada día por lograr alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Unos de sus planes futuros es poder ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Eva, who is 53 years of age and a merchant, makes and sells tortillas and meals. Her first Kiva loan was of much help, coming as it did when she most needed it, permitting her to make additional investment in her business, and to improve, little by little, her humble residence. The loan also made it possible to diversify her business.

Eva now needs financing to purchase more rice, sugar, corn, and firewood, because she wishes to sell more meals and to continue her daily struggle to achieve a better quality of life. 

One of Eva's future plans is expand her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, corn, and firewood for preparing tortillas and meals to sell.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Madame Akouvi âgée de 25ans est mariée à un déclarant en douane. Elle n’a pas d’enfant en charge pour le moment. Tresseuse de profession, elle exerce son activité dans une baraque. Par moment, elle manque des matériels de travail, c’est pour cela elle sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des mèches et des tissages. Elle espère à l’avenir agrandir son activité et prêter main forte à son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en: Akouvi is 25 years old and married to a customs agent. She has no children in her care at this time. A professional hair weaver, she runs her business in a small shack. She is currently suffering from a lack of work materials and is therefore requesting her first loan from WAGES in order to buy some hair extensions and weaves. She hopes in future to expand her business and support her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and weaves.

loans.name: Lucie

texts.fr: Lucie est une femme de 38 ans mariée mère de 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 8 et 22 ans.  Tous vont à l'école. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des fruits(papayes, oranges, ananas, pastèques) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 6 mois. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter le stock de fruits  pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Lucie, age 38, is married and the mother of three children, whose ages range from 8 to 22. They all go to school.

She's been a merchant for six months in a market in her town. She retails fruits (papayas, oranges, pineapples, watermelons) depending on the season.

She knows suppliers well. Over time and thanks to her experience in her field, she acquired a clientele that she also knows well. Nevertheless, she's constantly out of stock, because her working capital is limited, which forces her to sell all her stock before being able to resupply.

She would like to increase her stock of fruits in order to better satisfy her customers and avoid getting out of stock. She will put away her profits in order to expand her business, and also provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits to increase her stock

loans.name: Dalé

texts.fr: Dale vit avec son conjoint soudeur et leurs 03 enfants à Lomé. Les enfants sont âgés de 20, 17,10ans.Ils vont tous à l’école. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle revend depuis 1997 des œufs à domicile. Dans l'idée de se procurer plus de marchandises, elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter des œufs. Le profit lui permettra de construire une maison et avoir une boutique. elle est âgée de 42ans.
texts.en:
Dale, age 42, lives in Lomé with her spouse, a welder, and their three children aged 10, 17 and 20. All three children go to school. 

To assist her spouse with household expenses, Dale started selling eggs from her home in 1997. She is seeking a first loan to bolster her stock of eggs. 

The profits earned through her activity will help her to build a house and open a store.

loans.use: to buy eggs for resale.

loans.name: Rajan

texts.en: Ms. Rajan is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been helping in her husband's business of furniture making. The man shown in the photo is Rajan’s husband. They have been doing this together for many years. Over time, they have become famous in their community for providing good quality furniture. She is a responsible mother who provides her children with the basic necessities of life. In order to buy good quality wood, together with packs of polish and nails, in larger quantities, she applied a loan of 30,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR) from Kashf Foundation. In this way, they would be able to cater to more customers without delays, which would ultimately help in bringing home more cash. She is in her fourth loan cycle, with good repayment history. Rajan dreams of providing a bright and prosperous future to her children.

loans.use: to buy good quality wood, together with packs of polish and nails, in larger quantity, for her husband’s furniture-making business.

loans.name: Sanjuana

texts.es: La Sra.  SanJuana  tiene un pequeño negocio de comida ubicado en su casa . Tiene 2  años dedicándose a este negocio. Le  gusta cocinar  y preparar  comida Mexicana  nos comenta  que sus  clientes  le  dicen que la comida esta  muy sabrosa  y  frecuentan  muy seguido  su  pequeño negocio  y cada vez tiene mas cleintes; mas  sin embargo su  equipo de trabajo no es  suficiente  , es por eso que el dia de hoy esta solicitando un credito  para poder  comprar un Enfriador Industrial  para  almacenar  las Piezas de pollo y complementos de los platillos que elabora   ya que en este tiempo de Verano  el pollo es muy delicado  y necesita que estar en un lugar frio    y  también usara su credito   para comprar   algunas mesas y sillas para  acomodar a sus   clientes y asi   darles un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
SanJuana has a small business selling food from her house. She has been in this business for 2 years. She likes to cook and prepare Mexican food. She says that her clients tell her that the food is delicious and they return often. Her small business is gaining clients every day. 

Nevertheless, she does not have sufficient equipment. This is the reason she is requesting a loan today; to buy an industrial refrigerator to store chicken pieces and other ingredients used in the dishes that she makes. Because chicken meat is very delicate it needs to be stored in a cool place, especially in the summer. She will also use the loan to buy some tables and chairs to accommodate her clients and thus provide them with better service.

loans.use: to buy an industrial refrigerator, tables and plastic chairs.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en: Ms. Bushra is 37-year-old married woman. She started a business of sewing gloves one year ago, to bear the expenses of her family members. Her husband is a rickshaw driver whose income is not sufficient, by itself, to meet the needs of the family members. Bushra has accumulated a list of regular customers, and she earns enough to lead a civilized life. She has six children, among whom three are in school. For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of RKR 25,000. This amount will be used to buy a new sewing machine and some spools of thread. She hopes to cater to more customers, on a repeat basis, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine and some spools of thread for her glove-sewing business.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en: Ms. Asia is a 33-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has been in the business of tailoring for many years, to help her husband. She has accepted the fact that, if her husband alone works for their family, they will not be able to meet their household expenses and the educational needs of the children. That is why she started tailoring at home, to support her family well. Her husband is a factory worker. Asia, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. She has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy more reels of thread, packs of buttons, laces and zippers. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand of her customers without fail. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. Asia hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy more reels of threads, packs of buttons, laces, and zippers for her home-based tailoring business.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en: Ms. Iqbal is a 53-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling cloth, bed sheets and blankets for many years. She buys a variety of these things from the main city and then sells them to the people of her community, and she earns a good profit through her business. Iqbal has applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season, together with packs of bed sheets in various designs. In this way, she would be able to earn more income from greater sales. She is in her fifth loan cycle with a good repayment history. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season and packs of bed sheets in various designs, to sell in her business.

loans.name: Guadalupe Enrique

texts.es: Guadalupe, 36 años de edad, es cliente Kiva, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al  negocio de barbería. El se siente muy orgulloso porque su primer crédito le fue de gran ayuda, ya que ha podido incrementar sus clientela y a la misma vez tener mejores ingresos. Es por eso que hoy en día esta solicitando su segundo financiamiento para comprar, mesa, sillas, tijeras, peine, espejo, etc. Con el propósito  de mejorar la infraestructura del local en donde tiene su negocio para darle una mejor atención a sus clientela.
texts.en:
Guadalupe is 36 years of age, a Kiva client, and a merchant who has a barber business. He is very proud of the fact that his 1st loan was of great help, enabling him to increase his customer base and, at the same time, to have better income. That is why today he is soliciting his 2nd financing, so that he can purchase a table, chairs, scissors, combs, mirrors, etc.

Guadalupe intends to improve the infrastructure of the location where he has his business, in order to provide better service to his customers.

loans.use: to buy a table, chairs, scissors, combs, mirrors, etc., to improve his barber shop.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima stitches clothing in her house, which she has been doing for 10 years. She has been working night and day making elegant dresses for women in her community. She has attained a regular list of customers and earns enough to contribute to the family income. 

Due to lack of available of funds, Saima is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan from Kashf Foundation for 20,000 PKR, which she will use to buy more spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue. She hopes to provide a better standard of living for her four children.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads in different colors, packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Reyda

texts.es: Reyda, tiene 30 años, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia . Reyda se dedica a alquilar su mototaxi, tiene un vehículo que alquila a diario a un chofer de su localidad a cambio de un pago fijo al culminar su jornada de trabajo. Se inició en este negocio hace 8 años y sus ingresos diarios se han incrementado.Todo lo que realiza le gusta mucho y no duda en poner su mayor esfuerzo para trabajar cada día con mucho optimismo, su gran deseo ahora es refaccionar un mototaxi que por ahora tiene en estado de inactividad para hacerlo trabajar y complementar así su principal fuente de ingresos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 600, agradece la oportunidad y la ayuda que le brindan las personas para acceder a este financiamiento que le permite mejorar su trabajo además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de llantas y refaccionará el sistema de arrastre de su mototaxi inactivo.
texts.en: Reyda, 30 years old, is married and has 3 children with whom she lives in her own house. Reyda rents her motorcycle taxi for a living. She has a vehicle that she rents daily to a driver in her town in exchange for a fixed fee to complete their work day. She began this business 8 years ago and her daily income has increased. She likes this work very much and does not hesitate in putting her best effort into work each day with much optimism. Her great dream right now is to refurbish a motorcycle taxi that is now idle, and to complement her principal source of income. In this opportunity she will request S/. 600. She is grateful for the opportunity and the assistance that it provides the people through access to this financing that allows her to improve her work. Additionally she promises to make her payments in a punctual manner. She will invest the amount requested in the purchase of tires and she will refurbish the passenger cart in the inactive motorcycle taxi.

loans.use: to buy tires and refurbish her vehicle.

loans.name: Roger

texts.fr: Roger est un homme de 54 ans marié, père de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 5et 18 ans, tous vont encore à l'école. Il exerce une activité d'élévage depuis 3 ans déjà (il achète les poussins, les élève ensuite revend) elle fonctionne à merveille grace à son précedent crédit qui a permis d'agrandir sa ferme.
