Il sollicite à nouveau ce crédit pour acheter en grande quantité des poussin et aussi la provende ce qui lui permettra non seulement de satisfaire sa clientèle déjà grandissante mais aussi de réaliser un plus gros profit. Le benéfice que lui apportera ce crédit l'aidera à agrandir son activité( augmenter le nombre de poussins) et aussi à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille.
texts.en:
Roger, age 54, is the married father of four children aged 5 to 18 years old, all of whom are still in school. He has been running a livestock farming activity for over three years already (he buys chicks that he raises for resale). Business is booming thanks to a previous loan that allowed him to expand. 

Roger is seeking a new loan to buy a large quantity of chicks and some feed, which will enable him not only to meet the needs of a growing customer base but also to bolster his profits. 

The profits earned through this activity will help him to expand his business further (increasing the number of chicks to raise) and to provide for his family’s day-to-day needs.

loans.use: to buy chicks and feed.

loans.name: Tasawar

texts.en:
Tasawar is a 32-year-old, married woman. She is running a shop of ‘Pakora-making' and sales (i.e., a dish consisting of pieces of vegetable and chicken dipped in a gram flour or besan). She has been doing this business for six years with the support of her husband. 

The man shown in the photo is Tasawar’s husband.  They are expert in making good-tasting pakoras and earn enough money through this business to contribute to the family's expenses. 

In order to cater to more customers, they need to purchase a stock of gram flour with packs of oil, salt, and spices. For this, Tasawar contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of KPR 30,000. 

Tasawar is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of the revenue on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase for her business, a stock of gram flour with packs of oil, salt, and spices.

loans.name: Koffison

texts.fr: Koffisson est un jeune célibataire qui n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Il a démarré en 2012 son activité et revend des produits congelés dans une boutique. Il espère agrandir sa boutique et se marier plus tard. C’est dans cette  lignée qu’il sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des produits congelés.  Les profits tirés de la vente l’aidera à satisfaire ses besoins.
texts.en:
Koffisson is a young, single man without any children to support. In 2012, he started the activity of selling frozen products out of a shop. His plans are to expand his store, and eventually get married. 

To that end, he is seeking a first loan from WAGES to stock up on frozen products. The profits earned through this activity will help him to meet his needs.

loans.use: to buy frozen products for resale.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, de 49 años de edad,está casada con Miguel, vive en compañía de su esposo, sus 03 hijos y sus 02 nietos en su casa propia. Angélica se dedica a la venta de comidas, para desarrollar su trabajo ha establecido con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación un modesto restaurante en su casa. Realiza este negocio por más 07 años y trabaja con la ayuda de otra persona quien le apoya en la atención a los clientes que ha logrado consolidar gracias a la buena sazón que pone en cada uno de los platos que ofrece. Complementa cada plato con la venta de gaseosas y otras bebidas heladas.Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que le brinda buenos ingresos económicos con los que solventa los gastos básicos de su hogar, además se siente muy contenta generando su propia fuente de trabajo, por fortuna su negocio ha tenido buena acogida por los clientes y es por eso que desea brindarles una mayor comodidad y mantener la calidad y el buen sabor de los potajes que ofrece.Este es el préstamo número 05 con Kiva, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles, comprará algunos artículos de cocina que desea renovar como ollas, cucharones, platos, tazas, vasos y sartenes.
texts.en:
Angélica, 49 years old, is married to Miguel. She and her husband, their three children and two grandchildren live in their own house. Angélica sells meals and in order to advance her business she has, through a great deal of effort and dedication, opened a modest restaurant in her home . She has operated her business for more than seven years and is assisted by another person who helps wait on her customers, who are attracted by the good cooking she puts into each of the meals she offers. She complements each dish with the sale of soft drinks and other cold beverages. She appreciates her business because of the good income it provides, which she uses to pay basic household expenses.  In addition she enjoys generating her own source of livelihood.

Fortunately her business has been well patronized by customers. Consequently she wants to offer her clients better amenities while maintaining the quality and flavor of her concoctions. This is her fifth loan with Kiva. She is very grateful for the lending opportunity provided her and for the financial support she needs to move ahead. She promises to make her payments on time. With the sum of S/. 500 she will purchase some cooking materials she needs in order to upgrade, such as pots, ladles, plates, glasses and pans.

loans.use: to purchase cooking material, such as pots, ladles and plates, among other items.

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
Ms Rafia is a 38-year-old woman. She is the loving mother of 4 children. She enjoys her business of tailoring. With the support of Kashf Foundation she has built a successful business. Rafia has depth in the work of tailoring and her daughters help with her work. She earns enough for a hand-to-mouth existence. She remarked that she remembered doing stitching work with her mother in her childhood, and that was helpful for her to fight against poverty. 

Currently she requested a loan of Rs. 20,000 to purchase more spools of threads with packs of zippers and laces in various colors. While speaking to a loan officer at Kashf she said her children have never slept without having a meal ever since she started working on her own. She wishes to utilize part of the revenue for the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads with packs of zippers and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Saophea's Group

texts.en:
Saophea, 40, lives with her four children in a village in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Cambodia. All of her children are still in school. Saophea is a widow. To make a living, she has struggled to feed her children by planting cassava on two-hectares of farmland. Having been in this business for 12 years, she can earn approximately 27,000 KHR per day and she can save about 13,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.  

Saophea has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one loan cycle and completely paid back the loan. With the loans from VisionFund, she has managed to improve her livelihood. She is now leading her group of four to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pesticides for her cultivated land and plowing the field, and use a portion of it to spend on labor. With this loan, Saophea hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for her cultivated land.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Ms Naseem is a 48-year-old married mother who has been successfully running a small general store in her community. She sells a variety of everyday goods using her good communication skills and relying on a good list of clients. Her husband sells ice cream from his bicycle and earns insufficient income to support the needs of the family. Naseem is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide for their needs. As she wants to grow her business, she has requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to buy stocks of rice and flour from the market at lower prices. With these, she will be able to consistently meet increasing demand. She is in her second loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to cover personal expenses and to increase the business' capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice and flour for her store

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than 30 years now. Vilma is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of their fishing boat. Vilma is optimistic that through this loan she will be able to improve their fishing business.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Sreyyas' Group

texts.en:
A widow living in a rural village located in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province, Sreyyas is 60 years old and has two children. To make a living, she grows cassava on four hectares of farmland in her local area. She has been in this business for 12 years, earning about 55,000 KHR per day but is able to save about 28,000 KHR each day.

Sreyyas’s group consists of two female members. She has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two loan cycles. The past loans have helped her improve her livelihood. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,400,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high yield from her cassava business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a chuff-cutter.

loans.name: Somorn's Group

texts.en:
Somorn, aged 41, lives in a rural village of the Dambae district and has five children, two of whom are dependents and still in school. She is widowed. She has been growing cassava on two hectares of farmland in the area to make a living. She has been in this business for ten years. She can earn about 44,000 KHR per day and she can manage to save about 25,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

This is the micro-loan for Somorn’s group of two members who are both female. She is a fourth cycle client, while the other is a third cycle client with VisionFund. The past three loans that Somorn completely repaid have helped her to relieve her financial burden and improve her livelihood. Now requesting a loan, Somorn, who is the leader, will use her portion to plow the field and pay labor costs. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To plow the field and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Choen's Group

texts.en:
Choen is 50 years old and living in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district. She is widowed and she has six children. Rice farming is the main source for her family’s income, and she has been farming rice on a one-hectare area of farmland for about 25 years. The current business earns her family the daily income of about 38,000 KHR and she is able to save about 25,000 KHR each day. 

This is the first loan for Choen’s group of two members. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthfully and fruitfully so as to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Phat, 48, is a married mother who lives in a rural village located in the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She has four children, some of whom are in school. For the last 25 years, she and her husband have been farming rice to make a living. They can earn about US$9 per day to meet their family’s needs. 

Phat has been with VisionFund for five loan cycles and has completely paid back her past loans. These loans have helped her better support her family. She is now applying for a new loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and to use a portion to buy more plots of land to expand her business. She hopes this loan will help her to grow more rice that she can sell for a good price.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm land

loans.name: Junior Edwin

texts.es:
Junior es un joven muy trabajador y entusiasta, vive en el distrito de la tinguiña, el cual se caracteriza por desarrollarse la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, papa, entre otros. Junior es un joven de condición humilde, trabaja en un fundo agrícola de la zona como obrero y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a su madre con los gastos del hogar y sobre todo apoyar a su menor hermano con los gastos de sus estudios; el esta saliendo adelante porque quiere brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y ello lo motiva a seguir esforzándose.

Junior está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo el podrá comprar los útiles escolares para su hermanito, ya que ya inicio el periodo escolar y debido a la falta de sus útiles, su hermanito no puede cumplir  con las clases, así el podrá brindarle a su hermanos los materiales necesarios para estudiar y seguir trabajando y esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una profesión y sacar a su familia de la pobreza”.
texts.en:
Junior is a very hardworking and enthusiastic young man. He lives in the district of Tinguiña, which is known for agriculture, particularly the cultivation of cotton and potatoes among other crops.

Junior is a young man in modest circumstances. He works as a laborer for a farm in the area using his wages to help his mother with household expenses and above all to help his younger brother with school expenses. He is getting ahead because he wants to provide his family with a better quality of life. That is what motives him to continue making an effort.

Junior is very grateful to Kiva lenders for, thanks to their support, he will be able to buy school supplies for his little brother since school has already started and, without  supplies, his little brother cannot do his lessons. With the loan he will be able to provides the materials his brother needs to study and also continue working to make his own dream a reality, that of having a profession and lifting his family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies (books, notebooks and uniforms, among other items).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of fabrics and accessories.

loans.name: Felicia's Group

texts.en:
Felicia, 41, lives with her husband and five children in Teshie. She sells towels, bedsheets and materials. Thanks to this store, she generates a livelihood for her family.

Felicia would like to buy more towels, bedsheets and material to sell to customers so that she will be able to increase her sales and thus improve her family's quality of life.

She dreams of expanding her business and making it into the best one in the area. 

Felicia, together with Musilatu, needs GHS 1,600 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more towels, bedsheets and material to sell to customers.

loans.name: Hay's Group

texts.en:
Hay, 33, is widowed and residing in a rural village of the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she has been farming rice for fourteen years and sometimes she works for others for a fee to gain more income. She can earn about KHR 12,000 per day and can save about KHR 7,000 each day for future needs. 

Hay’s group consists of two members who are both female. They are with VisionFund this cycle. She and her group member are applying for a loan of KHR 500,000 each. She will use her portion to buy household necessities for the family. She hopes to have enough household supplies for her family's use and hopes to have a decent house to live in.

loans.use: To buy household necessities for the family.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Mrinzi

texts.en:
Mrinzi is a married woman and has eleven children, nine of whom attend school, while two are still young. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mrinzi operates a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a challenge of inadequate capital to expand her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, sugar, cooking oil and wheat flour to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, sugar, cooking oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa, de 34 años de edad , esta casada con Roger y tiene 5 hijos, todos viven en su casa propia.
El negocio que tiene Rosa es venta de comidas, para eso tiene todos los implementos necesarios como envases, cucharas y botellas ya que su trabajo la obliga a trasladar los alimentos hasta el lugar donde laboran sus clientes que son aserraderos o instituciones de horario corrido. Su negocio viene funcionando desde hace 2 años y trabaja sola.Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso fijo y de esa manera apoyar a  su pareja en los gastos del hogar deseando de esa manera progresar y brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Contrario a eso, lo que no le gusta es que su negocio aun es pequeño y desea poder hacerlo crecer e incrementar sus ingresos.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1500 soles, se siente agradecida por la oportunidad financiera que recibe y s compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará ingredientes al por  mayor para la preparación de comidas como arroz, aceites, fideos y demás.
texts.en:
Rosa, 34, is married to Roger and has five children.  They all live in their own house.

Rosa's business is selling food.  She has all the necessary implements, such as containers, spoons, and bottles, because her job requires that she transport the food to her customers' workplaces, which are sawmills or institutions that are open all the time.  She has run her business for two years and she works alone.

She likes her business because it allows her to have a fixed income to help her husband with the household expenses.  She wants to progress and give her family a better quality of life.  On the other hand, what she doesn't like is that her business is still small.  She wants to be able to make it grow to increase her income.

Currently she'll request 1500 soles [PEN].  She's grateful for this financial opportunity and promises to make her payments punctually.  With the requested amount she'll buy food  wholesale, such as rice, oil, pasta, and other ingredients.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, pasta, and other ingredients

loans.name: Reinaldo Jesús

texts.es:
Reinaldo Jesús de 39 años de edad, se encuentra casado y es padre de dos hijos menores de edad. En conjunto con su esposa trabajan en su proyecto de negocio. Producen lácteos como yogurt, los cuales son comercializados entre los vecinos del sector y algunas tiendas de la localidad.
Cuando termina la actividad, Reinaldo se dirige al pueblo a comenzar su faena prestando el servicio de moto taxi, actividad que realiza diariamente hasta las ocho de la noche. 
Con el fin de continuar con la producción de lácteos como actividad principal para el sostenimiento familia, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos y materia prima, que le permitirán responder a la demanda de su comunidad.
Su mayor deseo es permanecer siempre unidos como familia y garantizarles a sus hijos una calidad de vida digna.
texts.en:
Reinaldo Jesús is 39 years old, married, and the father to two young children.  Together with his wife, he works his business producing dairy products such as yogurt.  These products are sold to neighbors in his area and some local stores.  When he finishes that work, Reinaldo goes to town to start his other job, servicing moto taxis.  He does this work every day until 8:00pm.

In order to continue producing dairy products as the main economic activity to support his family, he is requesting this loan to purchase supplies and ingredients that will allow him to respond to the community's demand.  

His dream is to always stay together as a family and give his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and ingredients to make dairy products.

loans.name: Ninfa Del Rocio

texts.es:
Ninfa es una persona que se ha caracterizado por tener una gran creatividad y ganas de salir adelante. Sus cuatro hijos se han constituido en su principal motivación para ir en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades. Desde hace 12 años se dedica a la confección y elaboración de bisuterías, Labor que le ha permitido brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Cuenta con grandes clientes debido a la calidad en el servicio, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de de insumos como hilos, agujas, accesorios y telas. Con el fin de seguir  aumentando sus ventas. Espera mejorar su condición económica y ofrecerle a sus hijos una mejor educación y en un futuro el acceso a la educación universitaria. 
Su mayor sueño es tener un gran negocio, y convertirse en una fuente generadora de empleo.
texts.en:
Ninfa is a creative person who wants to improve her life.  Her four children have been her main motivation to go in search of better opportunities.  For 12 years, she has worked making clothing and jewelry, which has allowed her to give her family a better quality of life.  She has many customers due to the quality of her service.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase supplies such as thread, needles, accessories, and fabric in order to continue to increase her sales.  She hopes to improve her financial situation and give her children a better education, including access to a university education in the future.  

Her dream is to have a large business and to become a source of employment for others.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as thread, needles, accessories, and fabric.

loans.name: Diamado

texts.fr:
Âgée de 31 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants Diamado vit dans une famille polygame dans la ville de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). 
Diamado  mène des activités de commerce général notamment l’achat et la vente d’articles divers boutique depuis plus de 5 ans. Cette activité lui procure assez de revenus, sa demande est souvent très grande, car elle reçoit beaucoup de clients par jour. Pour la bonne satisfaction de sa clientèle et l’agrandissement de son activité, Diamado fait recours à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son  1er prêt  individuel. Ce prêt sera  utilisé pour l’acquisition des stocks de  diverses marchandises ( thé, sucre, savon, céréales, lait en poudre, cigarettes, biscuits et Lipton. Elle s’approvisionne auprès  des grossistes de Koutiala et effectue sa vente dans sa boutique à Koutiala KoKo à une clientèle mixte, en espèce. Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un  bénéfice mensuel de 40.000 FCFA  qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso, satisfaire aux petits besoins de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Diamado, age 31, is the married mother of five children. She lives in a polygamous family in the city of Koutiala (region of Sikasso). 

Diamado is a merchant who, for over 5 years, has been buying and selling staples. This activity brings in substantial income. Demand is fairly high, as she gets a lot of clients every day. 

To meet customer demand and to expand her activity, Diamado joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. This is her first individual loan. She will use the credit to stock up on various merchandise (tea, sugar, soap, cereals, powdered milk, cigarettes, cookies and Lipton products). She buys her stock from wholesalers in Koutiala, and she conducts her sales for cash out of her shop in Koutiala KoKo to a mixed clientele. 

With this loan, she expects to earn a monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay the interest on the loan from Soro Yiriwaso, to meet the needs of her family, and to invest in her activity.

loans.use: to buy staples for resale.

loans.name: Ngailut Group

texts.en:
Twelve hardworking tribal women form the “Ngailut Lom” group; it means “Love Group”. 

Lhingngah is the featured borrower, and she is pictured with her hand raised. She lives now with her 4-year-old adopted son after her husband passed away few years ago. She resides with her son at her brother’s house. 

When Lhingngah’s husband was alive, she had to borrow money from others for his treatment, since her husband had to go undergo prolonged medical treatment. As she had debts to pay back for her husband‘s medical treatment, after the death of her husband she started a small variety shop in her house so that she can slowly pay back the debts. 

Lhingngah runs a variety shop in her village, and her shop is located on the front side of her house. She gets the supplies from the main city and sells them at a profit in the village. She says she started her variety shop because there are very few grocery/variety shops in the village, and this will benefit her as well as the villagers. 

She says that she is able to pay back her previous debts and now she wishes to expand her shop by refilling the stocks. She will purchase canned fish, sugar and various cereals and sell them when she gets the loan. At present, she sells all daily essential commodities that are mostly used in the village. With the Kiva loan, she will get her shop refilled and try to make savings in the bank.

Lhingngah’s dream is to have her own house where she and her son can live. She hopes to let her son get a good education, and says her son is her motivational factor when she is losing hope in life. She is looking forward to life with positive aspects and guidance from God.

loans.use: to refill her variety shop and sell the goods.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo de 65 años de edad, creo desde hace 10 años en una pequeña tienda en la sala de su casa, después de ser desplazado por la violencia con su núcleo familiar. Con pocas probabilidades de emplearse, debido a su carencia educativa optó por subemplearse y generar los recursos para el sostenimiento de su hogar. 
Ricardo Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el fin de ofrecerles a sus clientes una mejorar calidad en el servicio.
Su sueño es independizar su negocio de la vivienda y capacitarse en el oficio de panadería para ampliar su portafolio de productos.
texts.en:
Ricardo is sixty-five years old.  For ten years, he has had a small store that is located in the living room of his house.  He began this business after being displaced by violence with his family; with few employment opportunities due to his lack of education, he opted to start his own business in order to generate income to sustain his home.

Today, Ricardo finds himself requesting a loan that he will invest in the purchase of items to stock his store, with the end result being to offer his clients a better quality of service.

His dream is to make his business independent from his home and to receive training so that he can start a bakery and grow his portfolio of products.

loans.use: to buy everyday products.

loans.name: Jurse

texts.en: Jurse, aged 38 years, is married with four children. He acquired a loan of UGX 2,000,000. All his children are in school. His business is tea farming and trade. His other sources of income are selling plantains from his plantation. He wants money to mulch his banana plantation and also to trade in green tea leaves. His business started in 1996 in Kibona Mashonga. He started the business to earn  a living since it was not easy for him to survive without any meaningful income. His clients are fellow farmers from the village who also grow tea but with no means of reaching the factory. The challenge is transport during rainy seasons. He thanks the bank for having such a cheap agriculture facility that has helped him to meet his financial challenges.

loans.use: To buy mulch for the banana plantation

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a widow. She sells palm oil at Jukwa near Abura. She has been selling palm oil for ten years now. She has four children. She is responsible for the upkeep of her children. Abena will use her loan to purchase gallons of oil and palm fruit to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business she wishes to produce in large quantity

loans.use: to buy gallons of oil and palm fruit to sell.

loans.name: Mazera

texts.en:
Mazera is a hardworking woman.She comes to you for another loan of KES 80000 to continue operating a retail shop business, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a challenge of lack of adequate capital to expand her business.

With the KES 80,000 she wants to purchase sugar, maize flour, soap detergents, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, maize flour, soap detergents, and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel appreciates the support from Kiva and is making progress in paying his first loan of $100.00. He is now seeking for a top-up loan of $50 to purchase 10 more rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Emmanuel started selling lights in January, 2013 and he has sold 20 lights to date, providing clean energy to 100 people. This loan will enable him reach an additional 50 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife and children.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Ana de 47 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicada en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocida por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Ana, age 47, lives in her own home with her husband and son. She has a store where she sells basic necessities such as beans, milk, eggs, bread, and other products. Ana has been in business for many years and the experience she gained from making sales has allowed her to generate more income. Her business is located in her home and is well-known among the neighbors in the area. She has many customers since her store is stocked.

Ana wants to grow her business, but making a new investment requires necessary capital. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy what she needs for her store. Ana is confident about repaying this debt and providing her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maryuris María

texts.es:
Maryuris se ha destacado como una mujer emprendedora. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de camisas, camisetas, pantalones y ropa para niño. Debido a la buena acogida que ha tenido entres sus vecinos y las personas del sector, Maryuris se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido y encargos que le han solicitado para el día de las madres. 
Su sueño es adecuar un local para abrir su tienda de ropa y aumentar su nivel de ventas, lo que le permitirá brindarle a su hija de nueve años de edad una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación.
texts.en:
Maryuris is an entrepreneurial young woman. For the last year, she has been selling shirts, t-shirts, pants and children's clothing. Because she has had great success selling to her neighbors and other people in her area of town, Maryuris is seeking a loan that she will use to purchase assorted clothing that people have ordered from her for Mother's Day. 
Her dream is to open her own clothing store and increase her sales, which would allow her to provide her 9 year-old daughter with a better life and good education.

loans.use: to purchase clothes wholesale

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is applying for a second loan to support his last year of studies at Maharishi Institute. He will graduate in December 2014. When asked about his progress since the first Kiva loan, Simon reports:

"I was able to do every course, and I was motivated to do well in each and every one of them because I knew that it was people's investment that made it possible for me to study."

video.title: Kiva Borrower Simon from South Africa

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Marc

texts.en:
Marc is very grateful for the first loan of $50 he received from Kiva. He is now seeking a top-up loan of $50 to purchase an additional 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. 

Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Marc started selling lights in October, 2012 and he has sold 30 lights, thus providing clean energy to 150 people, thanks to the support from Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for ten low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur lives in Goris town with his mother, and he works hard to improve their living conditions. He has been involved in agriculture for more than eight years. He breeds livestock, particularly lambs, and sells them in the local market. Artur works hard to gather income and sustain his and his mother's living.

Because the sole source of family income is the livestock breeding business, Artur would like to expand it. Therefore he has requested this loan, which he will use to purchase 30 lambs. This will enlarge Artur's agricultural activity and will help him to earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for 30 lambs

loans.name: Medzuwa

texts.en:
Medzuwa is a married woman who has three school-going children. She owns a house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a second-hand clothes business, selling from door to door, to her neighbors and passersby.  She faces a major business challenge, namely, seasonality in the sales of clothes. With the KES 20,000 she is borrowing, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, in order to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell

loans.name: Jhon Fredy

texts.es:
Jhon de 34 años de edad, es tatuador y presta sus servicios en un local ubicado en el municipio de Santa Rosa de Osos, Colombia. Desde hace varios años. Aprendió el arte gracias a la enseñanza de un amigo y posteriormente lo perfeccionó en una academia. Labora diariamente de nueve de la mañana a siete de la noche. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía especialmente artesanías y la adquisición de una vitrina.
Su mayor sueño es brindarle a su hijo de siete años de edad una vivienda digna y una buena educación.
texts.en:
Jhon, age 34, is a tattoo artist who provides his services from a shop located in the town of Santa Rosa de Osos, Colombia. He has been doing this for several years. Jhon learned his art thanks to a friend who taught him. He later perfected his skills at an academy. Jhon works every day from 9:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M.

He is requesting a loan so that he can buy merchandise, especially handicrafts, and a display cabinet. His greatest wish is to provide his seven-year-old son with a decent home and a good education.

loans.use: to buy handicrafts to sell and a display cabinet.

loans.name: Lerato

texts.en:
Lerato is appyling for a second loan to support one year of studies at Maharishi Institute. When asked about her progress since the first Kiva loan, Lerato reports:

"I am busy with my degree at the moment and will hopefully graduate next year. The degree courses are exciting and challenging, but I'm enjoying myself."

loans.use: to pay for one year of tuition fees and living expenses at the Maharishi Institute.

loans.name: Asi

texts.en:
Asi is married and has four children. She works as a baker in Jukwa (near Cape Coast), which she has been doing for 10 years.  Her husband is a driver. 

Asi is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase bags of flour and sugar  for her bakery. She uses all her income to support her husband to pay their utility and accommodation bills.  With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour and sugar for her bakery.

loans.name: Jose Asisclo

texts.es:
José,  posee un taller de estructuras metálicas y también se dedica a la agricultura. El vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, no tiene ayuda del extranjero; el trabajo del cultivo lo aprendió con su padre, ya que siempre lo acompañaba cuando realizaba la siembra y todo lo relacionado a la agricultura; y lo del  taller obtuvo los conocimientos en una escuela de estructuras metálicas. 
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá  en la siembra de maíz y pipián para comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas, plaguicidas. Este le ayudara a mejorar las ganancias, ya que sembrara más de lo acostumbrado y generara más ingresos.
Su sueño es hacer un muro perimetral en su casa para vivir mas seguros.
texts.en:
José has a workshop where he makes metal structures, but he also works as a farmer. He lives in his own home with his wife and children. José has no help from others abroad. He learned the agricultural trade from his father, who is always with him while planting crops and performing the rest of the farming duties. The knowledge he uses at his shop was acquired when he attended a school that teaches metalwork.

José is requesting a loan so that he can invest in the planting of corn and squash. He will buy compost, insecticides, herbicides, and pesticides. This will help improve his earnings since he will be able to plant more than usual. His dream is to build a wall around his house so that he can live more securely.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, herbicides, and pesticides.

loans.name: Phocus

texts.en: Phocus is a 33-year-old man from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. He is seeking a loan of $50 to purchase 10 rechargeable LED lights, which he will resell to people without electricity in his village. Every week or so, these customers will return to him to have their lights recharged for just $0.20. Phocus started selling lights in August 2012 and he has sold 30 lights to date, providing clean energy to 150 people. He is also a farmer and will reinvest the money he makes into expanding his other business to earn more money for himself, his wife Cecile and their child.

loans.use: To pay for 10 low-cost LED lights to resell to rural households without electricity.

loans.name: Malohat

texts.en:
Malohat is a hardworking woman. She has a great desire "to be a rich business lady." She is married and has three children. They live in a village which is far from town. For more than 13 years, she has owned a business selling rice. Her husband also sells food products to help her earn money. She is a repeat client of IMON and has a good credit history.
 
She is very sociable and has significant experience in her business, which is why she has many clients. She wants to develop her business further. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 TJS to buy rice. She awaits your support. This loan will help her to increase her business and maximize her profit.

loans.use: To buy rice

loans.name: Rasmiyya

texts.en:
Rasmiyya is 47 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in a small village. Rasmiyya loves nature and outdoors and since childhood has spent a lot of time helping her parents to raise livestock. To have a steady income and support her families needs, 13 years ago she began raising sheep and cattle and selling milk products and the animals once they are mature. 

Rasmiyya is requesting a loan, which she will use  to buy grass and feed for her animals.  At the time of her previous loans from VFAC, she only had two cows, but she increased the numbers of animals. She is hopeful that she will be able to complete all of her business goals so that she can improve life for her family.

loans.use: to purchase grass and feed for the livestock.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce works as a baker. She specializes in baking and selling bread, in Jukwa (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about two years. As a single mother with four children, she uses all her income to feed and provide for her family.

Joyce will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of flour, which will aid her in improving her overall bread sales. Joyce  wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of flour

loans.name: Teang

texts.en:
Aged 53 years, Teang is a widowed mother of four children. She lives in a rural village of the Sampov Meas district, of Pursat province, Cambodia. Rice farming on a two-hectare plot of farmland is the main source of her family’s income. Having engaged in this business for 30 years, she is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day, for current and future needs.

Teang has been with VisionFund for two previous loans. She completely repaid the past loans, and they enabled her to better support her family. Now she is asking for a new loan of 1,500,000 KHR. She will use a portion of it to buy fertilizer for her farmland and use another portion of it to pay labor fees. With this loan, she hopes to grow her rice healthfully and sell it for a good price, to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay for farm labor

loans.name: Ruhangiz

texts.en:
Ruhangiz has been running a bakery oven for the last two years with the handholding support of two workers. She bakes and sells bread, pita bread and pies.
 
With this income, she is hardly able to manage the educational expenses of her children in the future. So, with the help of her husband she wants to start an agriculture business parallel with the bakery by taking out a loan from VFAC. With the present loan, Ruhangiz wants to purchase one head of diary cow. 

Ruhangiz is 23, married and the mother of two children ages one and three. In the picture, you can see her family at her workplace.

loans.use: To buy one head of diary cow.

loans.name: Sokny's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Kror Kor district, Sokny is 30 years old and married. She has two children who are still too young for school. She is a rice farmer and supplements her income by selling snacks while her husband is a construction worker. Having been in this business for three years, she currently can earn about 14,000 KHR per day.
 
Sokny has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group of three to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sokny will use her portion to buy ducks and chickens to raise to earn additional income for the family. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy ducks and chickens to raise

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy is married and has two children. Both of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to both electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and electricity bills.   

She has a business selling second-hand clothes and shoes. She has been in this business for eight years. She works at the market five days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO. She will use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes. She is aspiring to one day be a seller at wholesale only, and also to build rental housing.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes to resell at the market

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson de 46 años de edad, se dedica a la producción de café, plátano, maíz, fríjol y papa en su finca ubicada en el municipio de Sonsón, Colombia. Con su actividad sostiene a su familia compuesta por su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad, a los que sueña con brindarles una  vida sin carencias económicas. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de abonos como fertilizantes y fungicidas para sus cultivos, lo que le permitirá tener una cosecha más abundante y de mejor calidad, para brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Nelson, 46, makes a living growing coffee, bananas, corn, beans, and potatoes on his farm in the town of Sonsón, Colombia.  With this job he supports his family, made up of his wife and two minor children, whom he dreams of giving a life without financial need.

Currently he's requesting a loan to invest in buying soil amendments such as fertilizer and fungicide for his crops.  This will allow him to have a bigger and better harvest and give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and fungicide

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa cooks eggs for sale. She is married and has three children.  Theresa uses her income to support her husband with the general up keep of their family. Theresa will use her loan to purchase more eggs to cook for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more eggs to cook for sale

loans.name: Mazera

texts.en:
Mazera is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for the past two years, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding and becoming a big supplier of fish in the future.

With the KSHS 10,000, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua is a petty trader. She prepares and sells smoked fish, fanti kenkey, and other foods, at Jukwa, near Abura. She has done this work for five years. Ekua is married to a farmer, and she has six children. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children, and pay their school fees. She will need this loan to purchase more fresh fish to smoke, and bags of maize for the fanti kenkey. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to smoke, and bags of maize for making fanti kenkey

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Ms Bushra, a 37-year-old married mother of four, is motivated to provide her family with good food, clothing and health. In pursuit of these goals, Bushra has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house for three years now. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as he has developed and maintained many contacts there over the years.

Bushra wants to grow her business and so has requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase a stock of flour, grain and sugar to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of flour, grain and sugar.

loans.name: Djelika

texts.fr:
Mme Djélika est âgée de 51 ans,  mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle réside avec  son mari et ses enfants  dans le quartier  Kôkô de la préfecture de Koutiala (Région de Sikasso). Elle a prématurément abandonnée les études, ainsi elle a embrassé les activités génératrices de revenus. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par s’intéresser à l’achat- vente du bois de chauffe il y’a plus de 9 ans.
Le bois de chauffe est l’un des éléments essentiel pour les femmes Maliennes  dans la  préparation (cuisine),  raisons pour laquelle, Djelika très sollicitée, peut vendre des chargements de remorque par mois.  
Afin de combattre les ruptures de stock survenant pendant l’hivernage, elle n’a pas pris du temps pour rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Après deux prêts tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son troisième qui sera utiliser pour acheter  3 chargements de remorque de bois de chauffe dans les villages  environnants  de la ville de Koutiala. Elle effectue sa vente  devant sa porte au quartier Kôkô à une clientèle mixte au comptant. 
Avec ce prêt en plus de son fonds propre, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 115 000FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le remboursement des taux d’intérêts de Soro, contribuer aux dépenses quotidiennes  de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djélika is 51 years old, married and the mother of three. She lives with her husband and children in the Kôkô district, Koutiala prefecture (Sikasso Region). She has abandoned her studies early and started earning a living. After trying various activities without success, nine years ago she started buying and reselling firewood. 

Women in Mali depend on firewood in order to be able to do their cooking, which is why Djelika has many customers and can sell several trailer loads each month. After having to deal with stock shortages during the rainy season, she lost no time  in turning to the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution once again. With two loans correctly repaid, she is on her third loan, which will be used to buy three trailer loads of firewood in the villages near the town of Koutiala. She sells in front of her home in the Kôkô district, for cash, to a diverse clientele.

With this loan added to her working capital, she plans to achieve a monthly revenue of 115,000 West African francs, which she will use to repay Soro’s interest, help cover everyday household expenses, and reinvest the rest in her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Robinah Prossy

texts.en: Robinah Prossy is married with two children, both of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her mother). She has a tailoring business and has been in this business for eight years.  She has applied for a loan of 2,500,000 Uganda shilling from MCDT-SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing material and an electric sewing machine. She generates additional income from selling charcoal stoves. She works from a shop she rents six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality, transportation and defaulters.  She is aspiring to own a tailoring school, to educate her children up to university and to build her own house. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of cloth and an electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Saron Lom Group

texts.en:
Nenglhing is the featured member of the group called ‘Saron Lom’. She is pictured with her hand raised. She is 60 years old and has four sons and two daughters. She is quite old yet she is strong willed. She is a loving mother. Her husband serves as a priest in the village where she lives.

In the past, Nenglhing used to buy vegetables from the surrounding villages and sell them in the market. She could make some earnings out of this but the earnings were too small. Apart from the small earnings she made, the job she had taken up was threatening her health because she could not have her meals on time and she had to travel long distances. So she decided to change her business from buying and selling vegetables to raising piglets and selling full grown pigs. By doing this, she needs not go from one place to another and she can keep herself healthy and make more earnings.

Nenglhing now wants to buy more piglets and builds a better pigsty. For this, she needs a sufficient amount of money. So she wants to avail a loan from Kiva through WSDS. She is hoping that by raising more piglets and selling them when fully grown, she will make more profit. The profit she makes will be kept as savings and with the money, she wants to build a new house. She is also surprised that someone like Kiva is lending generously to someone unknown!

The other members of the group are engaged in weaving, raising piglets and different business for daily wages.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Better's Group

texts.en:
Better's Group is made up of two enterprising members who sell dried fish and provisions respectively. Better, 33 years old and single, has worked for three years selling dried fish from her home. This helps her earn income to support her sick mother and herself. She is requesting this loan to purchase healthy dried fish. Her dream is to own a fish depot and sell wholesale.

Joyce, who is 36 years old and sells provisions, will use her portion of the loan to purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.use: To purchase healthy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Saiqa

texts.en:
Saiqa is 26 years old woman and married. She is in the business of selling milk to help her husband financially in meeting the needs of her family members. She has one buffalo in milk and sells the milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk.  

To inflate her sales, Saiga is requesting her second loan for 25,000 PKR, which she will use to purchase another buffalo. With a second buffalo, she will be able her to cater to more people in her community.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms. Parveen is 23 years old and a married woman. She has been doing a business of carpet manufacturing for the past eight years. She offers various handmade carpets and has become famous in her circle, for providing good-quality products. She is happily doing it for the sake of her family. She earns enough to lead a decent life.

For the improvement of her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 15,000. She will use it to buy good-quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers, in order to increase her sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan, and she dreams to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy good-quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers, to increase her sales of carpets.

loans.name: Naziran

texts.en:
Ms Naziran is 51 years old and a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son, at the corner of her house. She has 10 years of experience in this field.  Her son also assists her by purchasing goods for their inventory from the market, as he has maintained many contacts there, for years.

She is a mother of three children and is motivated to provide her family with good-quality food, clothing and health care. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 45,000. She will use the loan to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages, to fulfill the increasing demand at her store. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages, to resell at her store

loans.name: Janat

texts.en:
Janat is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of two children. She has been successfully running a small general store from the corner of her house. Shown in the photo, Janat’s husband helps her by buying goods from the market. Both are happily working together to bear the expenses of their children.

Janat has successfully paid off three previous loans. She is now applying for a 25,000 PKR loan through the Kashf Foundation to buy grain and packets of cleaning products such as soap, shampoo and detergent to sell. In this way they will be able to meet the demands of their customers without fail.

Through this loan Janat expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of growing her business ever further.

loans.use: to buy grain and packets of cleaning products to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms Razia, who is married and provides for three children, had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. Deciding to help her husband support her family for a better future, 12 years ago she began doing stitching work in her home. She stitches for the people in her area, and uses the income to support her entire family.

Due to insufficient funds, Razia is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. Having requested her sixth loan for Rs 30,000 from Kashf, she will use the money to buy raw material including clothes, threads in various colors, and packs of laces and zippers to meet those demands and generate a healthier income.

loans.use: to buy raw material including clothes, threads in various colors, and packs of laces and zippers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, meat, cheese, and other supplies.

loans.name: Galo

texts.es:
El Señor Galo vive en Guayaquil (suburbio), el tiene 64 años de edad. El trabaja vendiendo pollo en el invierno, y en el verano trabaja con varios artículos que los vende a sus vecinos para así tener más ingresos económicos para su familia.

El realiza su trabajo solo, desde  las  8:00 de la mañana hasta las 14:00 de la tarde, el teme enfermarse  y no poder seguir trabajando ya que es el único que trabaja en su casa. El está casado, su esposa es ama de casa, si tiene hijos pero son ya mayores de edad.

El utilizara el préstamo para invertirlo en papeleria y venderla ya que es la epoca escolar en la Costa del Ecuador y se vende muy rapido los utiles escolares. El desea para el futuro tener un triciclo para poder distribuir mejor sus pollo, y productos de verano que el vende.
texts.en:
Galo, age 64, lives in Guayaquil (suburb).  He works selling chicken in the winter.  In the summer he works with various items that he sells to his neighbors in order to have more income for his family.

He works alone from 8:00 in the morning until 2:00 in the afternoon.  He fears getting sick and not being able to continue working because he is the only one who works in his house.  He is married, and his wife is a housewife.  He has children, but they are now adults.

He will use the loan to invest in stationery goods to sell.  He will do this because it is now the school season in the Costa del Ecuador, and school supplies sell very rapidly.

In the future he wishes to have a tricycle in order to be able to better distribute his chicken and the products he sells in the summer.

loans.use: to buy stationery goods.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva, a married mother of three children, two of whom attend school, also takes care of additional family members. She resides in her own house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and feeding the family.

Eva has a business selling used bags and women shoes, and generates additional income from rental rooms. She works in a shop seven days a week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.

Eva has requested a loan of Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of bags and used shoes. She aspires to own a fully-stocked clothing shop and also to build more rental rooms.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes and bags.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Ms Noor, a 21-year-old motivated unmarried lady, has expertise in embroidery, and has been using her skill to provide financial support to her family for over six years. She started this line of work at a very young age, and during the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required material. Today, she is proud to be famous in her community, known as the best at making beautiful patterns with threads and beads. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

Noor wants to grow her business, so she has requested a loan of PKR 25000 to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand of her customers. She hopes to improve her income and wishes to spend part of it on the betterment of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand of her customers.

loans.name: José Dimas

texts.es:
José tiene 27 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene una hija de dos años de edad. Desde hace nueve años se dedica al cultivo de plátano; toda su familia  se dedica a este cultivo, él tiene mucha experiencia, debido a que para cultivar plátano se debe tener muchos conocimientos en cuanto al manejo de las plagas.
Los insumos agrícolas que necesita, los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a 18 kilómetros de su casa; como no hay transporte, se reúnen varios agricultores y pagan un vehiculo para ir a comprar todos juntos y de esta manera les sale más barato el viaje.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar semilla de plátano y sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno. Él siembra 2,700 semillas por 7,000 metros cuadrados. Con el préstamo, podrá comprar la semilla que necesita en el momento justo y preparara la tierra, como el arado y el rastreo para dejarla en el punto. Su propósito es que sus ingresos mejoren, para comprar su propio terreno y ampliar su casa y algo muy importante para él es brindar el estudio a su hija.
texts.en:
José is 27 years old, married, and has a two-year-old daughter. For the past nine years, he has been growing bananas. His entire family engages in this business. José has plenty of experience since growing bananas requires a great deal of knowledge in how to manage pests.

The farming supplies he needs are obtained at a city that is 18 kilometers from his house. Since there is no transportation, he meets with several other farmers to hire a vehicle to bring in all of their supplies together. This reduces the cost of the trip.

José is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy banana seeds for planting 7,000 square meters of land. He will plant 2,700 seeds to cover 7,000 square meters. With the loan, he will be able to buy the seeds at the right moment. For now, the land has to be plowed and tilled before being left fallow. His plan is to improve his earnings so that he can buy his own land and expand his house. Something else that is very important to him is providing for his daughter’s education.

loans.use: to buy banana seeds to plant on 7,000 square meters of land.

loans.name: Mónica María

texts.es:
Mónica de 40 años de edad es madre de tres hijos, se dedica a la actividad de la confección desde hace de 10 años. El taller se encuentra ubicado en su residencia y se dedica principalmente a la confección a terceros.
Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una máquina recubridora y una plana, debido a que la producción ha aumentado y requiere de contratar una empleada. Se siente muy agradecida con Dios por las grandes bendiciones de cada día le concede, asegura que su más bello regalo es su familia por la cual lucha incansablemente a fin de garantizarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mónica, 40, is the mother of three children.  She has made a living sewing for 10 years.  Her workshop is in her house and she mainly sews for third parties.

She's requesting a loan to invest in buying an overlock machine and a tabletop machine because production has increased and she needs to hire an employee.

She's very grateful for the great blessings that God grants her every day.  She says her most beautiful gift is her family; she strives tirelessly to guarantee them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and a tabletop machine

loans.name: Asli

texts.en:
Asli is 47 years old, married and the mother of a 25-year-old son. She is a good, kind, hardworking and happy woman.

Asli buys fruits and vegetables at wholesale for her husband to sell at the bazaar. In addition, for the last five years she and her husband have been raising cattle; she is good at managing them. The couple started with three head of cattle and now have eight. Asli raises animals for their meat, milk, yogurt, cheese and butter.

Asli is applying for a 1000 AZN loan through Vision Fund AzerCredit to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell. She hopes for your charity and pledges to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Juana Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña juana de 37 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la que vende Productos perecederos como refrescos, golosinas, dulce y otras serie de artículos comestibles y no comestibles; a través de este comercio ha sacado adelante a su familia, doña juana busca mejorar su calidad de vida, por lo que esta solicitado un credito para incrementar la variedad de artículos en su tienda, lo que le permitiría incrementar las ganancias de su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su grupo familiar
texts.en: Juana is 37 years old and lives with her husband and three children.  She has a small store where she sells perishable items such as drinks, snacks, candy and other edible and non-edible items.  She has gotten her family ahead through this business and Juana has improved her quality of life.  She is asking for this loan in order to increase the variety of items in her store, which will allow her to increase her income and improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Marta Dora

texts.es:
Marta de 43 años de dad, se encuentra casada y tiene una hija de trece años.
Desde hace nueve años inició su negocio dedicado al servicio de fotocopias, trascripción de textos, venta de papelería y útiles escolares. Inicialmente atendía el negocio desde su casa pero gracias a la excelente respuesta de la gente, alquiló un local en un punto más estratégico. 
Desde hace tres años decidió trasladarse para una institución educativa en donde considera le va mucho mejor, debido a que su público objetivo se encuentra allí.
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de  tintas, resmas de papel y útiles escolares con el fin de mantener el stock. 
Su mayor deseo es permanecer unidad a su familia en lazos de amor y paz.
texts.en:
Marta, 43, is married and has a daughter, 13.

Nine years ago she started her business making photocopies, transcribing texts, and selling paper and school supplies.  In the beginning she conducted business at home, but thanks to the excellent response from people she rented a locale in a more strategic place.  Three years ago she decided to move to an educational institution where she thinks it's going much better for her because her target audience is there.

Currently she's requesting a loan to invest in buying ink, reams of paper, and school supplies to update her stock.

Her greatest desire is to stay close to her family through ties of love and peace.

loans.use: to buy ink, reams of paper, and school supplies

loans.name: Saleem

texts.en:
Ms Saleem is a 52-year-old, married woman and mother of two. She has been pursuing a business of sewing for 12 years, to support her husband. She accepted the fact that, if her husband were to work alone for their family, they would not be able to meet the expenses of the household and the educational needs of their children.  She sews clothes, bed sheets and covers, and earns enough to contribute to the family income. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Recently, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000. She will use it to purchase more supplies for sewing, including spools of thread, and packs of buttons and lace. With these materials, she will be able to meet the increasing demand for her services. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Saleem hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more supplies for sewing, such as spools of thread, and packs of buttons and lace

loans.name: Aqeela

texts.en:
Aqeela is 31 years old and married. She is a skilled seamstress with three children, two daughters and a son. She works hard to help to keep them fed, clothed and healthy. Her husband works as a labor, but his income isn’t sufficient to meet the family’s daily needs.

Aqeela started as a seamstress with the financial support of Kashf Foundation. At present, she enjoys a good clientele and is popular in her community.

Aqeela took out her first loan to buy a sewing machine. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has a good repayment history. Currently, Aqeela is applying for a 30,000 PKR loan to buy thread in different colors plus packs of buttons and needles. She wants to be able to meet her customers’ demands without fail.

Aqeela’s ambition is to grow her business so she can give her children a good education. She hopes to accomplish this through hard work.

loans.use: to buy thread in different colors plus packs of buttons and needles.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Ms Azra is 46 years old and a married woman. She has been in a beauty parlor business for six years. She knows that the income of her husband is not enough to meet all of their expenses. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling, and facials. Through her providing the best services, she has become very famous in her street.

In order to satisfy the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying a greater variety of cosmetics, bleaching cream and hair care products, in large quantity. Therefore, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 35,000. She is hoping to attract more customers, time after time. She has a dream of building a house of her own in the community, where she could live with her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cosmetics, bleaching cream and hair care products, in large quantity.

loans.name: Umme

texts.en:
Ms Umme is a 37-year-old lady; she has been stitching clothes for 17 years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She is supporting her family in meeting expenses, because her husband’s income, alone, is not enough to bear the expenses of the family members.

By this time, she has attained a list of regular customers. However, due to a lack of available funds she is unable to fulfill the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 15,000. She will use the loan to buy more spools of thread in various colors and packs of lace, zippers and buttons, to create a means of increasing revenues. With these supplies, she may able to generate a healthier income. She dreams of opening a boutique shop, to display her collection.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in various colors and packs of lace, zippers and buttons, to create a means of increasing revenues.

loans.name: Bilqees

texts.en:
Ms Bilqees is a 42-year-old, married woman, who has been doing a business of selling milk for the past three years. She has one buffalo in milk, and she sells its milk to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough for her to afford a decent life. She has two children, and both of them are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life, with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. Her husband is working on daily wages, but his income, alone, is not enough to meet household expense.

This is her second year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business with the support of Kashf financing. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 25,000, which she will use to purchase another buffalo. She hopes to get an increase in milk production capacity, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Ms. Razia is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been manufacturing mens' belts for the past ten years. She beautifully makes belts at home and then sells them in the local market. She has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family's income. Her husband also helps her in this business. She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to purchase threads and leather in various colors to increase her production. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She is in her 5th loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. Razia wishes to utilize part of her revenue to provide a good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase threads and leather in various colors to increase her production

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam appreciates the previous Kiva loan, which helped her to boost her business. For the past years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business. Her potential customers are women. She faces a challenge of stiff competition in her business. Mariam dreams of expanding her business and offering suitable products to her customers.

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase cosmetics and hair weaves to resell at her shop. She decided to join Yehu, to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and hair weaves to resell at her business

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a married man, aged thirty nine years, and he has four children aged between one and eleven years. He operates a boda boda business in an urban area, and he has been in this business for six years. He plans to buy another bicycle for the same business. George plans to use the anticipated profits to reinvest in his business. He is a committed person and hopes to open a transport company in the future and to own some motorcycles in five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To buy another bicycle for transportation purposes

loans.name: Zaituni

texts.en:
Zaituni is a married woman with four children. All of her children attend school. She does not have to care for additional family members. She and her family reside in a house, where the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

To earn a living, she operates a restaurant. She has been in the restaurant business for ten years. She serves food to all types of people for retail prices. She generates additional income by selling charcoal. She explains that she works from home seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges are seasonality, the ever-increasing prices of food in Uganda, and customers who default on their required payments.

She has applied for a loan in the amount of 1,700,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more food, including bunches of green bananas, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes, ground nuts, fish, chicken, rice and cassava. She dreams of owning a fully-stocked restaurant and buying a plot of land. She decided to join MCDT because of the low interest rates applied to their loans.

loans.use: To expand and improve her restaurant business by purchasing additional foods (e.g., bananas, beef, sweet and Irish potatoes, ground nuts, cassava, rice, and chicken)

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a married woman with one school-going kid. She lives at her own house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three months, she has operated a retail shop business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge in her business, of competition from other retail shop operators. With the KES 25,000 loan, she wants to purchase stock for her shop, including, for example, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, cooking oil and washing detergents. She decided to join Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, cooking oil and washing detergents, for inventory

loans.name: María Angélica

texts.es:
María de 68 años de edad, enviudó hace algunos años, por lo cual debió asumir las responsabilidades del hogar y la educación de sus dos hijos. Decidió unirse con madres cabezas de familia y comenzar su propio negocio dedicado a la preparación de eventos, como bautizos, matrimonios y reuniones sociales. Realiza la actividad de  jueves a domingo y el resto de la semana comparte con su familia y realiza los oficios domésticos. Debido al poco presupuesto y a la carencia de implementos, María asegura que en muchas ocasiones no puede prestar sus servicios, razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de bandejas, jarras, manteles, mesas y sillas. 
Está convencida que después de realizar dicha inversión su negocio comenzará a crecer exponencialmente. 
Su mayor deseo es disfrutar de su vejez con su familia y no padecer de ninguna carencia económica.
texts.en:
María, 68, was widowed several years ago, so she had to assume responsibility for the household and the education of her two children.  She decided to join forces with mothers who are heads of household and start her own business organizing events such as baptisms, weddings, and social events.  She does this job from Thursday through Sunday and spends the rest of the week with her family and doing the domestic chores.

María says that often she can't offer her services because of a small budget and a lack of implements, which is why she's requesting a loan to invest in buying trays, pitchers, tablecloths, and tables and chairs.  She's convinced that her business will begin to grow exponentially after she makes this investment.

Her biggest desire is to enjoy her old age with her family and not suffer any economic need.

loans.use: to buy trays, pitchers, tablecloths, and tables and chairs

loans.name: Rafiqa

texts.en:
Ms Rafiqa is a 56-year-old widow. She is the mother of one daughter and two sons. She works hard to satisfy their wants and demands, including food, clothing, and medical and marriage expenses.
